title: sengoku_collection
body:
A mobile social networking game created by [[Konami]], which was launched for the Mobage service in December 2010.

The series features female representations of feudal lords from the Sengoku period. An anime television series produced by Brain's Base based on the game aired on TV Tokyo between April 5, 2012 and September 27, 2012.

Game ended service on May 30, 2019.

title: gerudo_set_(zelda)
body:
A disguise [[Link]] wears in order to infiltrate the [[Gerudo]] village in [[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild]]. 

The outfit, like the rest of Gerudo attire, is [[arabian clothes]], with a [[veil]], [[detached sleeves]] and [[harem pants]]. Link wears a [[circlet]], [[armlet]]s and [[bridal gauntlets]], and a [[halterneck]] [[bandeau]] that shows off his [[bare shoulders]].

Link also has a male Gerudo set of clothing known as the [[Desert Voe Set (zelda)|]].

title: testament_(guilty_gear)
body:
Free-willed Gear from [[Guilty Gear]] who was originally a human child and changed into the way they are today by the Post-War Administration Bureau.

In [i]Guilty Gear[/i], they plotted to revive [[Justice_(guilty_gear)|]]. In [[Guilty Gear X]], they dedicated themselves to protecting [[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]]. They were adopted by [[Kliff Undersn]].

They fight using a [[scythe]] made of [[blood]] along with their unnatural Gear powers.

Testament is [[1other|non-binary]] according to their official bio as of [[Guilty Gear Strive]], with prior depictions leaning masculine.
 
They have [[succubus familiar]]s at their command.

h4. External links

* "Official Website: Testament":[https://www.guiltygear.com/ggst/en/character/tst/]
* "Guilty Gear Wiki: Testament":https://guiltygear.fandom.com/wiki/Testament

title: emolga
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #587 National Pokédex, a dual type Electric/Flying Pokémon.

Emolga is a white, rodent-like Pokémon resembling a flying squirrel. It has black eyes, a tiny nose, and yellow cheek patches. It can create electricity on its electric sacs located on its cheeks and store electricity inside its membranes. Its ears, positioned at the top of its head, are rounded in shape and black in coloration, with yellow and white sections of coloration in the inside of its ears. It sports a vaguely hood-like patterning of black around its head, with a spiky extension of the pattern above its face.

Japanese name: [b]Emonga[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Sawsbuck]]
Next Pokémon: [[Karrablast]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Emolga":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Emolga_(Pokémon)

title: tanghulu
body:
A traditional Chinese snack of candied fruit. Tanghulu are often mistaken for regular candied fruits; however, they are coated in a hardened sugar syrup. This sweet and sour treat has been made since the Song Dynasty and remains popular throughout northern China.

The most common fruit used for tanghulu is [[shanzha_(fruit)|]], but you can also find other variants with [[strawberry]], [[mandarin orange]], [[kiwi_(fruit)|]], etc.

Not to be confused with [[candy apple]] or [[dango]].

h4. See also

* [[Chinese food]]
* [[candy apple]]
* [[Tung Fue Rue]] - A [[Fatal Fury]] character with the same hanji.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tanghulu":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanghulu

title: ima-no-tsurugi
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. Official art by [[shikimi (yurakuru)|Shikimi]]. Voiced by [[Yamashita Daiki]].

He is (allegedly) the personal [[tantou]] of [[Minamoto no Yoshitsune]]. Dressed like a tengu as an homage to his owner having allegedly been trained by one. As he said in his introductory line, he was there from his owner's time at the temple to his very last moment. 

Has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He wears a [[tokin hat]] with a [[chin strap]], some sort of [[stole]]. Has a [[sode]] on his left shoulder, a [[kusazuri]] and wears [[tengu-geta]]. His [[Ima-no-tsurugi (Kiwame)|Kiwame]] form is dressed in more [[Japanese armor]], along with a bird headdress that mirrors his emotions.

Ima-no-tsurugi is a straightforward and cheerful child, treating fighting as though it's a game and boasting himself of being the fastest tantou. He has an extraordinary sense of balance and can jump about cheerfully on one-toothed geta. Despite his bonds with Minamoto no Yoshitsune, Ima-no-tsurugi is very loyal to the [[Saniwa (touken ranbu)|]], who he puts before himself. He's often seen hanging out with [[Iwatooshi]], due to their masters' shared past.  

After his Kiwame remodel, [spoiler]it's revealed he's a fictional sword and never interacted with Yoshitsune at all. Despite this, he understands that he exists because of the Saniwa, and vows to stay by their side and help them.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Touken Ranbu Wiki: Imanotsurugi":http://touken-ranbu.wikia.com/wiki/Imanotsurugi

title: tear_troughs
body: Known anatomically as nasojugal folds, grooves or lines. This is where the eye socket meets the slope of the nose (the infaorbital area), which sometimes creates a prominent groove on the skin between this area. Tear troughs may be more or less pronounced due to several factors. This includes body fat, skin density, health, and genetics. With those factors in mind, tear troughs are more prominent on average amongst women, Caucasians, older individuals, and those who are [[skinny]] or [[emaciated]]. Some characters have pronounced tear troughs as part of their canon design, such as [[Sakata Kintoki (Fate)|]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. h5. Examples * !post #7420807 * !post #7025019

title: spirit:_stallion_of_the_cimarron
body:
[b]Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron[/b] (also known as Spirit) is a 2002 American animated Western film produced by [[dreamworks|DreamWorks Animation]]. 

Set in the Old West in the late 19th century, the film follows Spirit, a mustang stallion (voiced by [[Matt Damon]] as a narrator), who is captured during the American Indian Wars by the United States Cavalry; he is eventually freed by a Lakota man named Little Creek with whom he bonds, as well as a mare named Rain.

h4. Characters

title: german_flag
body:
The modern [[flag]] of [[Germany]], consisting of three horizontal bars colored black, red, and yellow.

It was used from 1919 to 1933 by the Weimar Republic, from 1949 to 1959 by both East and West Germany, from 1959 to 1990 only by West Germany, and from 1990 to the present by unified Germany.

Not to be confused for the [[Belgian flag]].

title: onisaki_kirara
body:
Kirara Onisaki (鬼崎 きらら), born Freya (フレイヤ), is an important recurring character in the online games. Designed by [[Aoi Nagisa (metalder)]]
She is a Taimanin and a senior student at Gosha Academy. Kirara is a half-demon, with her mother being a high ranking Kijin of Frost, and her father being part of the demon killing. Onisaki clan. Her original name was Onisaki Freya. Many people assume that the ice she can control is her Ninja Art, but this is not the case, the ice is part of her frost demon heritage, while she often hesitates to use her real Ninja Art.

title: moelotl
body:
An eastern-themed humanoid race evolved from axolotls, Moelotls appears to be humans with axolotl gills as ears and think, slimy tail they can detach painlessly as decoy for enemies. Physically weak and fragile, and has innate fear to mechanoids faction due to their history, these people perfected a cultivation method to utilize their inner Qi energy to perform devastating attacks and made weapons powered by said Qi in order to dispatch their enemies.  

Cultivating a Moelotl's Qi energy takes a long time, but the payoff are worth the while. Their ranged attacks can takes waves of enemy mechanoids in one hit!  

Link to steam workshop page: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3292351432

title: milira_(rimworld)
body:
Miliras are a race of warmongering people with angelic appearance, complete with rings of light atop their head and white colored wings growing from their waist. In battles they command mechanoids/gynoids called 'Milian' which uses naming scheme based on chess pieces, and uses large area-of-attack skills tied to their weapons.

Link to steam workshop page: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3256974620

title: waverider_crash
body:
[[Zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|Zeta Gundam]]'s trademark finishing move, first seen used in the final episode of its [[Zeta Gundam|eponymous show]] and commonly featured as the unit's strongest attack in [[Super Robot Wars]]. 

In [[wave rider|Waverider]] Mode, the Zeta Gundam does a high-speed ramming maneuver onto its target, which is rendered unable to move by the former's Biosensor System. The Biosensor also uses the spirits of the deceased (usually those of who have a relationship with the pilot such as friends or even enemies) to boost the power of this attack. 

[spoilers]Zeta's pilot [[Kamille Bidan]] uses this move to kill [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who was prior to this, untouchable in combat thanks to his Newtype powers, piloting skill and the speed and tough armor of his [[The O (mobile Suit)|]] [[mobile suit]]. Despite decisively winning using this move, it became Kamille's undoing due to Scirocco being able to hit him with a mind-crippling psychic attack at close proximity with his dying breath, that turned him insane afterwards (and becoming a vegetable at the start of [[Gundam ZZ]]).[/spoilers]

This tag is also used for the exaggerated facial expression Scirocco makes during the scene.
other_names: ウェイブライダー突撃

title: moonflower_(flower)
body:
[i][b]Ipomoea alba[/b][/i], commonly called moonflower, is a species of [[flower]]ing plant of the genus [i]Ipomoea[/i] in the family [i]Convolvulaceae[/i].

As a species of [[morning glory]], it shares the same features. The flowers are funnel-shaped, but instead of blooming during the day, they bloom at night. The flowers are usually white, but sometimes pink.

Its common Japanese name, ヨルガオ (夜顔 [i]yoru-gao[/i]), literally translates to "night face".

h4. Examples
* !post #4777749
* !post #4801789

h4. See also
* [[Epiphyllum]], another night-blooming flower

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Ipomoea Alba":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ipomoea_alba
* "Wikipedia: Convolvulaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convolvulaceae

title: zoom_cat_lawyer_(meme)
body:
A reference to a viral video on February 9th 2021, taken from a live stream of a civil forfeiture hearing, and being held on the [[video_call| video conferencing application]] [[zoom_chat| Zoom]] in Texas' 394th Judicial District Court. The video features attorney Rod Ponton, who is struggling to disable a cat filter that shows a [[white_cat| white kitten]] mask over his face, resulting in it appearing as if a [[cat|]] is speaking. Also known as "I'm Not a Cat".

May or may not include a cat filter being used.

body:
A [[science fiction]] racing game in the [[Star Wars]] series, originally released in 1999 for [[Nintendo 64]], [[Game Boy Color]], [[computer|PC]], and [[Macintosh]], later ported to [[Sega Dreamcast]] in 2000 and [[Nintendo Switch]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[Xbox One]] in 2020.

The game is based off the [[podracer|podracing]] scene in [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace|The Phantom Menace]], and features tracks on a variety of planets.

title: star_wars:_dark_empire
body: Dark Empire is a [[Star Wars]] comic book metaseries produced by Dark Horse Comics. It consists of a six-issue limited series written by Tom Veitch and drawn by Cam Kennedy, followed by a second six-issue limited series by Veitch and Kennedy, followed in turn by a two-issue limited series written by Veitch and drawn by Jim Baikie. The initial series is notable for being one of the first Star Wars comics to be produced by Dark Horse, which retained the comic rights to the franchise for over two decades.

title: star_wars:_the_acolyte
body: The Acolyte, also known as Star Wars: The Acolyte, is an American science fiction television series created by Leslye Headland for the streaming service Disney+. It is part of the [[Star Wars]] franchise, set at the end of the High Republic era before the events of the Skywalker Saga, and follows a [[Jedi]] investigation into a series of crimes.

title: star_wars:_tales_of_the_jedi
body: Star Wars: Tales is an American animated anthology television series created by Dave Filoni for the streaming service Disney+. Each installment consists of six shorts that explore different characters from the [[Star Wars]] franchise. The first, Tales of the Jedi, explores [[Jedi]] from the prequel trilogy era, while the second, Tales of the Empire, explores characters related to the Galactic Empire. The series is produced by Lucasfilm Animation, with Charles Murray as head writer and Filoni as supervising director.

title: star_wars:_resistance
body: [[Star Wars]] Resistance is an animated television series that premiered on October 7, 2018, and concluded on January 26, 2020, having aired on [[Disney]] Channel and Disney XD.

title: siaro_merkreet
other_names: シアロ・メルクリート

title: ashihara_yumeji
body: "Character Profile":[https://tw6.jp/character/status/f42894]

title: joystick
body:
A device used to control a character in a videogame. Distinguished from the more generic [[game controller]] tag  by the presence of an obvious stick, e.g. a fightstick, a flightstick, a hand-stick as found on most arcade videogames, or analog thumbsticks as found on the controllers for home consoles such as [[Nintendo 64]], [[Playstation 2]]/[[Playstation 3]] or [[Xbox 360]].

A game controller for home console, without sticks as described above, would be a [[gamepad]].

Also used to control actual vehicles such as aircraft, but also occasionally used in pairs for armored land vehicles.

title: megaphone
body:
A funnel (cone) shaped device held to the mouth, and used for amplifying or directing sound.

This tag also includes electronic megaphones, also known as [b]bullhorns[/b], which are a device that combines a [[microphone]] with an amplified [[horn speaker]] and are used as a portable [[public address system|PA system]].

h4. See also

* [[Airhorn]]
* [[Shouting with hands]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: bookmark
body: Piece of cardboard or plastic inserted between the pages of a book used to a mark a point in the book the reader intends to restart from or refer to in a later time.

title: osananajimi_no_mama_ja_iya?
other_names: 幼なじみのママじゃイヤ?
幼なじみのママじゃイヤ

title: pager
body: A small, wireless communication device popular during the 1980s. No longer commonly used due to the rise of smartphones. Known as [i]pocket bell[/i] or [i]pokeberu[/i] in Japan.

title: clipboard
body: A small board with a clip on the top to fasten a bunch of papers together. It is a practical way to do writing on the go for professionals such as researchers, doctors and restaurant servers.

title: minidisc
body:
A magneto-optical data storage format developed by [[Sony]], mainly for use with music. Looks similar to a small [[CD]] in a [[CD case]].

* !post #6604718

h4.External links:
* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MiniDisc
* "MiniDisc Community Portal":http://minidisc.org/

title: briefcase
body:
A case used for carrying documents, such as [[paper]]s or files or [[book]]s. Mostly used by business people.

Not to be confused with a [[suitcase]].

h4. See also

* [[Satchel]]
* [[Handbag]]
* [[Backpack]]
* [[Duffel Bag]]

title: bomb
body:
A type of [[explosive]] [[weapon]]. Typically small, spherical, and set off by fuse, but there are many, many variations.

Unlike missiles or mortar shells, bombs do not propel themselves toward the target.
h4. Types
* [[aerial bomb]]
* [[C4|C-4]]
* [[dynamite]]
* [[nuclear weapon]]
* [[pipe bomb]]
* [[suicide bomb]]
* [[time bomb]]
* [[TNT]]

h4. See also
* [[defusing]]
* [[grenade]]
* [[gunpowder]]
* [[mine (weapon)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

body:
[[Scenery]] that represents the physical aspects of a [[city]] or urban area.

* [[architecture]]
* [[city]]
* [[landscape]]
* [[seascape]]
* [[rooftop]]
* [[scenery]]

title: stadium
body: A place or venue for [[playing sports|sports]], [[concert]]s, or other events held primarily [[outdoors]], consisting of a partially or fully enclosed [[field]] or [[stage]] in a tiered structure designed to allow spectators to [[standing|stand]] or [[sitting|sit]] and watch the event.

title: factory
body:
A [[building]] or facility designed for the development, production or construction of certain kind of objects or products.
h1. See also
* [[industrial]] (for factory-like environment setting)
* [[junkyard]]
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]

title: rainbow
body:
An arc of spectral colors - often seen in the sky - caused by refection of the sun's rays. 

Has the following associated colors: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, and Violet - collectively known as "ROY G BIV."

h4. See also

* [[colorful]]
* [[double rainbow]]
* [[rainbow background]]
* [[rainbow hair]]
* [[rainbow order]]
* [[rainbow gradient]]
* [[rainbow path]]
* [[rainbow text]]
* [[Tag Group:Colors]]

title: volcano
body: An opening in a planet's crust where magma, gases, and volcanic ash escape from below the surface. Typically depicted as a [[mountain]] with [[smoke]] or [[lava]] coming out from the top.

title: eggplant
body:
Egg-shaped [[fruit]] having a glossy skin and white flesh. Usually has a purple skin, but also comes in other colors such as white and orange. Used as a [[vegetable]] in cooking, closely related to [[tomato|tomatoes]] and [[potato|potatoes]]. Also refers to the [[plant]], which is a hairy [[herb]] of the nightshade family. Also known as an "aubergine" in the UK and Ireland.


h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* [[shouryouuma]]
* [[hatsuyume]]

title: mandarin_orange
body:
An orange-colored citrus fruit that is smaller than an [[orange (fruit)|]]. 

Popularly enjoyed in Japan during the wintertime, especially while sitting underneath a [[kotatsu]]. 

h4. See also

* [[mikan box]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: oden
body:
A Japanese winter dish consisting of several ingredients such as [[hardboiled egg]]s, [[daikon]] radish, [[konnyaku_(food)|konnyaku]], and processed [[fish cake]]s stewed in a light, soy-flavoured dashi broth.

While these are the core ingredients, oden is very much subject to regional and personal variations.

h4.  See also

* [[Nabe]]
* [[Sukiyaki]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: popcorn
body:
A popular snack food made by heating up maize kernels until it can no longer tolerate the pressure and pops, releasing its starches inside. From there, the popcorn can be seasoned or sweetened as desired. It is iconic with watching movies.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: chipmunk
body: Small, striped rodents of the family Sciuridae (the same as [[squirrel|squirrels]]). Chipmunks have an omnivorous diet primarily consisting of seeds, nuts and other fruits, and buds.

title: puffer_fish
body:
A species of [[fish]] that is known for inflating its body when it is threatened. Also known as a blowfish.

Most species of puffer fish are highly poisonous, but some are considered a delicacy and can be eaten when prepared properly.

h4. See also

* [[puffer fish vomiting water (meme)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tetraodontidae":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetraodontidae]

title: the_boss_(smiling_friends)
body: Character in [[Smiling Friends]]. He is the eccentric CEO of Smiling Friends Inc., and the employer of all the main characters.

title: toothbrush
body:
A small stick with firm bristles used for [[brushing teeth]] to remove plaque and keep teeth clean.

h4.See also

title: glep_(smiling_friends)
body: Minor character in [[Smiling Friends]]. He is a small green critter who speaks in gibberish and works an unknown position at Smiling Friends Inc.. Often seen with [[Allan (smiling friends)|]].

title: pim_pimling
body: One of the two protagonists of [[Smiling Friends]]. He is a small pink Critter that is all in for making people develop happiness, as that is his job at Smiling Friends Inc.. He works alongside [[charlie dompler|Charlie]].

title: allan_(smiling_friends)
body: Minor character in [[Smiling Friends]]. He is a red critter who maintains the building Smiling Friends Inc. operates from. Often seen with [[Glep (smiling friends)|]].

title: tuvaluan_flag
body: The national flag of [[Tuvalu]]. A light blue field with the [[Union Jack]] on the top hoist side, with 5 [[star (symbol)|]]s on the fly side.

title: thai_flag
body:
The flag of the Kingdom of [[Thailand]] shows five horizontal stripes in the colors red, white, blue, white and red, with the central blue stripe being twice as wide as each of the other four. The colors are said to stand for nation-religion-king, an unofficial motto of Thailand, red for the land and people, white for religions and blue for the monarchy.

The design was adopted on 28 September 1917, according to the royal decree issued by Rama VI.

title: serbian_flag
body:
The national flag of [[Serbia]]. A horizontal tricolor of red, blue, and white, with the coat of arms positioned slightly hoist-side of center.
* !asset #20078714

title: smiling_friends
body:
Smiling Friends is an adult animated television series created by Zach Hadel and Michael Cusack for [[Cartoon network|Cartoon Network's]] night-time programming block [[Adult Swim]], which revolves around the surreal misadventures of a small company and its four employees dedicated to spreading happiness. The show utilizes a wide variety of different art styles and animation techniques. This includes but is not limited to stylized traditional animation, CGI, rotoscoping, stop motion, and live-action.

h4. Characters
* [[Charlie Dompler]]
* [[Pim Pimling]]
* [[Allan (smiling friends)|]]
* [[Glep (smiling friends)|]]
* [[The Boss (smiling friends)|]]

title: polish_flag
body: The national flag of [[Poland]]. It has a white stripe above a red stripe. Heavily resembles the [[Indonesian flag]], which is a red stripe above a white stripe.

title: republic_of_china_flag
body:
The [b]Republic of China flag[/b], often called simply the Taiwanese flag, is the [[flag]] that has de facto represented [[Taiwan]] since the end of the [[Chinese Civil War]]. The design consists of a white sun in a blue canton on a red field. In Chinese, the flag is commonly called the [b]Blue Sky, White Sun, and a Wholly Red Earth[/b] flag.

Used by the [[Kuomintang]] party since 1917. The official flag of the Republic of China since 1928. Since 1949, mostly used in Taiwan, where the Republic of China has continued to exist.

Not to be confused with the [[people's_republic_of_china_flag|People's Republic of China flag]] (the flag of Mainland China, widely known simply as the [i]Chinese flag[/i]).

* !asset #20124411

h4. See also

* [[Five-colored flag]] (historical)
* [[Hong Kong regional flag]]
** [[Black Bauhinia flag]]
* [[People's Republic of China flag]] (a.k.a. Chinese flag)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flag of the Republic of China":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_Republic_of_China 
* "Wikipedia: List of Chinese flags":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Chinese_flags

title: people's_republic_of_china_flag
body:
The [b]People's Republic of China flag[/b], the Five Star Red Flag, often called simply the "Chinese flag" is the flag that has [i]de facto[/i] represented Mainland China since the end of the Chinese Civil War. The design consists of a group of golden stars on a red background.

* !asset #20077398

Designed, developed and officially introduced in 1949. The red field is officially meant to symbolize [[communism]], the big yellow star the Communist Party, and the four smaller stars meant the farmers, workers, intellectuals, and the bourgeoisie. Some people interpret the stars to be meant the five major ethnic groups of China, with the Han Chinese getting the large star and the four other stars meant to be Manchurians, Mongolians, Tibetans, and Uyghurs.

Not to be confused with the [[republic_of_china_flag|Republic of China flag]] (a.k.a. Taiwanese flag). 

h4. See also

* [[Five-colored flag]]
* [[Hong Kong regional flag]]
* [[Republic of China flag]] (a.k.a. Taiwanese flag)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flag of the People's Republic of China":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China
* "Wikipedia: List of Chinese flags":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Chinese_flags

body:
Simplified Chinese: 王者荣耀 (Wangzhe Rongyao)
Subtitle: Glory of the king
Unofficial English title: King of Glory
Official English title: Honor of Kings

A Chinese mobile MOBA game, published by Tencent Games for Android and iOS, largely inspired by [[League of Legends]]. Although unknown in most of the world, it is one of the most played and most profitable video games of all time with hundreds of millions of players. Prior to being released globally in 2022, it received an international adaptation in 2016, known as [[Arena of Valor]], with altered designs to accommodate the Western market.

title: remora
body: A ray-finned fish of any species in the family [i]Echeneidae[/i], which have dorsal fins adapted into a suction device. Using this device, they attach themselves to larger marine animals with which they form symbiotic relationships, removing parasites in return for protection and transport. In popular culture, remoras are best-known for attaching themselves to sharks (hence the common name "sharksucker"), though they have been known to attach themselves to turtles, whales, and even human divers.

The former flag which was adopted from 1918 to 1921 (and from 1991 to 2004) consists of a dark red field with black and white bands in the canton.

title: american_flag
body:
The flag of the [[united_states|United States of America]], colloquially known as the [b]Stars and Stripes[/b]. It serves as a symbol of the country's unity, independence, and democratic ideals. 

The design of the American flag consists of 13 horizontal stripes alternating between red and white, representing the original 13 colonies that declared independence from [[united_kingdom|British]] rule. In the top left corner, commonly referred to as the canton, there is a blue rectangle containing 50 white, five-pointed stars arranged in nine rows. These stars represent the 50 states of the United States. The design of the flag has evolved over time as new states joined the Union. The current version with 50 stars became official on July 4, 1960, after [[Hawaii]] became the 50th state.

The colors of the American flag also hold symbolic meaning. Red represents valor and bravery, white signifies purity and innocence, and blue represents vigilance, perseverance, and justice.

The American flag is widely recognized and displayed in various contexts, including government buildings, schools, homes, and during public events and holidays such as Independence Day ([[fourth_of_july|July 4th]]). It is treated with respect and reverence, and there are guidelines and protocols for its proper handling, folding, and display.

For images that only show patterns or other symbols representing the United States rather than the flag itself, use the [[United States]] tag.

h4. Example

* !asset #20076915

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Flag of the United States":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_United_States]
* "Wikipedia: United States of America":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_of_America]

h4. See also
* [[Historical American flag]]

* [[American flag bikini]]

title: disintegration
body:
When a character or object is breaking into [[shards]] or something else solid, such as [[butterfly|butterflies]], [[petals]], et cetera. Be sure to include [[distortion]] or [[body horror]] when applicable.

* !post #6879054
* !post #4296893

*  If a character is secreting an object or abnormal fluid, such as bleeding out flower petals, use [[alternate body fluid]].

* Use [[dissolving]] instead if a character is becoming incorporated into a [[liquid]] or [[smoke]].

* Use [[melting]] instead if a character or object is [[dripping]].

h4.See also

* [[crumbling]]
* [[dissolving]]

title: matsuda_seiko
body:
Matsuda Seiko is a renowned Japanese pop singer and actress, often referred to as the "Eternal Idol." 
She gained immense popularity in the 1980s and has been a significant influence in Japanese pop culture. With her charming voice and numerous hit songs, she continues to be an iconic figure in the Japanese entertainment industry.

title: dolphin
body:
海豚 (いるか, イルカ) - also refers to other small whales such as porpoises or beluga

Small, social carnivorous toothed [[whale]].

h4. See also

* [[List of animals]]
* [[inflatable dolphin]]
* [[orca]]
* Wikipedia: "Dolphin":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolphin

title: satellite
body: Anything orbiting a [[planet]]. It can be natural (like the [[moon]]) or artificial.

title: skateboard
body:
A short narrow board with two small wheels fixed to the bottom of either end, on which a person can ride in a standing or crouching position, propelling themselves by occasionally pushing one foot against the ground.

h4. See also

* [[hoverboard]]
* [[kick scooter]]
* [[skateboarding]]
* [[surfboard]]
* [[snowboard]]

title: tractor
body:
A tractor is a large [[motor vehicle]], typically with large rear wheels, primarily used to move heavy objects over rough terrains, especially [[farm]]s for [[farming]] purposes.

h4. See also

* [[Two-wheel tractor]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tractor":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tractor]

title: cockroach
body:
Common insect pest, often [[censored]] for comic effect. In Japan, the word for them is "gokiburi", sometimes shortened to G -- especially by terrified girls who don't even want to speak their name.

Contrary to popular belief it is not poisonous and thus easy to handle manually.

title: boomerang
body:
A curved piece of wood or other similar material, most of which are designed to return to the thrower. Probably the most well known is the Australian version, although boomerangs in other shapes (and from other cultures) also exist. Boomerangs are used mainly as [[toy|toys]] and hunting [[weapon|weapons]].

h4. See also

* [[frisbee]]
* [[shuriken]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boomerang

title: abacus
body:
Ancient manual calculation device still used in East Asia today. Japanese term is [i]soroban[/i] (そろばん).

h4. For more info:

* "Wikipedia, Abacus article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abacus
* "Wikipedia, separate article for the Japanese abacus":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soroban

h4. See also

* [[calculator]]

title: garlic
body:
A plant with cloves inside a bulb, belonging to the [[onion]] family. It is very popular in Italian cuisine and as an overall flavoring agent in cooking. It also has medicinal benefits by improving cardiovascular health.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: avocado
body:
A vegetable native to [[Mexico]] with a green-skinned, fleshy body that may be pear-shaped, egg-shaped, or spherical. Its skin is pitch black or green.

While technically a fruit, it is often served with salty foods like meat, [[taco]]s and [[torta]]s.

Main ingredient of [[guacamole]].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: professor_layton
body:
A puzzle-adventure series exclusively released on [[Nintendo DS]] and [[nintendo_3ds|3DS]]. The series revolves around an Archeologist named [[Hershel Layton]], a gentleman and lover of all things puzzle. The games are designed by [[Level-5]] and feature brain-teaser puzzles that range from simplistic to downright maddening.

There are presently six games released so far. The first three games are referred to as "episodes" 4, 5, and 6, while the fourth through sixth games are part of a prequel trilogy. Starting with the seventh, the series moves forward in time.

h4. Games
* [i]Professor Layton and the Curious Village[/i]
* [i]Professor Layton and the Diabolical Box[/i]
* [i][[Professor Layton and the Unwound Future]][/i] (EU: [i]Professor Layton and the Lost Future[/i])
* [i]Professor Layton and the Specter's Flute[/i]
* [i]Professor Layton and the Miracle Mask[/i]
* [i]Professor Layton and the Azran Legacy[/i]
* [i]Professor Layton and the New World of Steam[/i]

h4. Films
* [i]Professor Layton and the Eternal Diva[/i]

h4. Spinoffs
* [i][[Layton Brothers: Mystery Room]][/i]
* [i][[Professor Layton vs. Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney]][/i]
* [i]Layton 7[/i]
* [i][[Layton's Mystery Journey]][/i]

body: The "pleading face" [[emoji]], 🥺.

title: poop_emoji
body:
The infamous "pile of poo" [[emoji]] (💩).

Typically rendered as a brown, coil-shaped pile of feces with big eyes and a friendly smile. It enjoys a wide range of idiosyncratic usage, typically silly or whimsical.

Its existence owes to Japanese toilet humor, as an holdover from earlier proto-emoji systems.

title: crying_emoji
body:
The "Loudly Crying Face" (😭) [[emoji]], typically used to indicate, as the name entails, loud [[crying]], typically over something sad or happy.

Strongly associated with the "[[Uohhhhhhhhh! (meme)|]]" meme, used to indicate such excitement it brings you to tears.

One of the founding members and first leader of the Glasgow Gang, until [[Siege (arknights)|]] took the leadership. Since then, she has become the second-in-command and one of Siege's most loyal friend.

Her motif is based on the white tiger.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Hara Yuko (Japanese), Miao Yang (Chinese), Polly Eachus (English), and Lee Sae-byeok (Korean). Her art designer is [[Infukun]].

title: gwenpool
body:
A [[Marvel]] comics character, first appeared as an amalgam of [[Gwen Stacy]] and [[Deadpool]] created by Chris Bachalo for a variant cover of Deadpool's Secret Secret Wars #2, which was one of twenty such variant covers published due to the popularity of [[Spider-Gwen]] from June 2015. Marvel later created her as a fully-fledged character because of the popularity of the design. Her real name is [b]Gwendolyn "Gwen" Poole[/b]. She has other codenames such as [b]Pink Slayer[/b].

An unemployed 18-year-old high school dropout and a comics fan who was transported to the Marvel Universe from the real world, Gwen has vast meta-knowledge about the Marvel Universe and can break the fourth wall to interact with readers. [spoilers]She even has the ability of reality manipulation which she later used to retcon herself as a mutant[/spoilers].

Unlike [[Spider-Gwen]], she's not a variant of [[Gwen Stacy]] or [[Deadpool]].

title: aak_(arknights)
body:
[i]Aak, Specialist Operator of Rhodes Island, will support other Operators from the rear.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Lungmen[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 25[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]161 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A medical personnel from [[Lee (Arknights)|]]'s Detective Agency, he was a well-known underground doctor operating in the gray zones of Lungmen. After joining, he proved to be a tremendous wellspring of medical knowledge and theory with the clinical experience to back it up, though his style of practice is rather worrying. However, based upon [[Kal'tsit (Arknights)|Kal'tsit's]] comprehensive evaluation, he was recommended on a provisional basis to the medical equipment department and technological development team.

Does not get along well with Rhodes Island operators, with notable exceptions such as [[Hung (Arknights)|]] and [[Waai Fu (Arknights)|]], who are his agency colleagues, and [[Warfarin (Arknights)|]], who regularly gets into discussions with her regarding medicine.

Infamous among the player base for dealing massive friendly fire damage in exchange for immense power boosts.

His motif is based on the [[komainu]]. His [[voice actor]] is [[Sanpei Yuuko]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3851625: Default.
* !post #3851626: Elite ii.
* [[Aak (Doctor of Faces) (Arknights)|Doctor of Faces]]
* [[aak_(healing_hand_evil_heart)_(arknights)|Healing Hand, Evil Heart]]
* [[aak_(ambience_synesthesia)_(arknights)|Ambience Synesthesia]]

title: three-wheeler
body:
A [b]three-wheeler[/b] is a [[motor vehicle]] with three wheels. 

They're commonly based on the same technology as [[motorcycle|motorcycles]] and [[scooter|scooters]] and come in a standard configuration of 1 front wheel and 2 back wheels or a reverse configuration of 2 front wheels and 1 back wheel.

h4. Types

* [[Autocycle]]
* [[Reverse Trike]]
* [[Sidecar]]

h4. Three-wheeler car models
* [[Daihatsu Midget]]
** [[Tuk-Tuk]]
* [[Mazda Go]]
* [[Reliant Robin]]

h4. See also
* [[Tricycle]] (non-motorized three-wheelers)

title: tricycle
body:
A variant of [[bicycle]] with three wheels. Tricycle varies in design, ranging from a small toy tricycle to a larger rickshaw variant.

This tag is for the pedal-powered, three-wheeled vehicle. For a motor vehicle with three wheels, use [[three-wheeler]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[Bicycle]]

title: narugino_mikatan
body: A female character from the series [[Punch Line]]. She has [[green_eyes|green]] to [[blue_eyes|blue]] colored eyes, thick eyelashes, and [[pink hair]] decorated with bells.  Publicly she is a member of an idol group, but behind the scenes she dons on a costume and is a superhero named [[Strange Juice]] who has an orange (fruit) themed outfit and fights with an over-sized [[drinking straw]].  She possesses the ability to power-up her physical abilities, which causes her hair to change to a glowing orange color and her eyes to glow with a flowery [[+_+|+]] shape appearing over them.

title: iridatsu_yuuta
body: The protagonist of the anime series [[Punch Line]]. Upon seeing women's underwear he gets excited and gains superhuman abilities, but seeing women's underwear again while in this state causes him to overload and faint.  After a bus hijacking incident, an unknown spirit also steals possession of his body and forces him to be a roaming spirit. He's now stuck trying to figure out how to return to his body.

title: chiyoko_(punch_line)
body:
A young girl with dark hair from the series [[Punch Line]].  She has thick eyelashes, a small amount of hair tied on the left side of hair, and two short tufts of hair that stick out on the right side of her hair.

The boy Pine, the girl Guriko, and Chiyoko were three kids who grew up together.

title: frederica_rosenfort
body:
A young female character from the series [[86 -Eightysix-]].  She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[red eyes]].

Frederica is the adopted daughter of Ernst Zimmerman, the Federal Republic of Giad's temporary President. She serves as the "mascot" of the Nordlicht Squadron.
other_names: フレデリカ・ローゼンフォルト

title: shourei_nouzen
body:
A male character from the series [[86 -Eightysix-]].  He is the older brother to the protagonist [[Shinei Nouzen]].  He has [[red hair]] and [[black eyes]], the opposite of his younger brother.  He also wears a pair of [[glasses]].

Nicknamed Rei, Shourei is an 86er who served before his younger brother.  His Personal Name, a name granted to veteran 86ers as their permanent call sign, is Dullahan. This matched his personal emblem for the mecha he pilots, a [[m1a4 juggernaut|Juggernaut]], which was a headless skeleton holding a sword.
other_names: ショーレイ・ノウゼン

title: grete_(spy_kyoushitsu)
body:
[quote][i]I’m code name Daughter Dearest—now, let's fill this time with laughter and tears.[/i][/quote]

Grete is a female character from the series [[spy_kyoushitsu|Spy Classroom]].  She is 18-years-old with [[short_hair|short]] length [[red hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. 

She is depicted as rather reserved, though possesses a very tactical mind.  Her code name is "[i]Daughter Dearest[/i]" (愛娘 [i]manamusume[/i], "[i]beloved daughter"[/i]) and her specialty is disguises. She is member 5 of team Lamplight.

title: daihatsu_midget
body:

Known as the basis of the [[Tuk-tuk]] taxis in several countries.

h4. See also
* [[Daihatsu Midget II]]

title: object_(vehicle)
body:
Objects are (generally) large mostly spherical war machines featured in the series [[Heavy Object]].

They have heights around 50 meters (164 feet) tall and weigh around 100k metric tons (110k short tons). They're armed with a large quantity and variety weapons for fighting infantry, vehicles, and other objects.  Objects are also heavily armored, easily being able to shrug off all but the heaviest of weapons.  Due to this, it is generally accepted that the only way to defeat an object is by fighting against it with another object.

h4. List of Objects

* [[Baby Magnum]], piloted by [[Milinda Brantini]].
* [[Gatling 033]], piloted by [[Ohoho_(heavy object)|]].

title: daihatsu_midget_ii
body: A four-wheeled kei truck produced by [[Daihatsu]]. It was a revamped version of the original [[Daihatsu Midget]], and were produced from 1996 to 2001.

title: ohoho_(heavy_object)
body: A female character from the series [[Heavy Object]]. She is a [[object_(vehicle)|object]] elite (pilot) for the Intelligence Union.  Her real name hasn't been revealed, so the main character gave her a nickname based on her laugh. She is also referred to by the nickname "G Cup" for her listed bust size.

title: aya_drevis
body:
The main protagonist and the player character of [[Mad Father]]. She is the only child of [[monika_drevis|Monika]] and [[Alfred Drevis]].

Aya is 11 years old. She has long, black hair with [[blunt bangs]]. Her normal outfit consists of a blue, [[puffy_sleeves|puff sleeved]] ankle-length dress, with a white [[apron]] worn over it, and tied in a bow at the back. As accessories she wears a [[necklace]] with a gold pendant, and a big pink [[hair_bow|bow]] on the back of her head.

title: battle_rifle
body:
A [[gun|firearm]] that uses full-power [[rifle cartridge|ammunition]] (e.g. 7.62×51mm NATO), capable of fully-automatic fire or selective fire, and uses removable magazines. They were the connecting link between semi-automatic rifles (SVT-40, Gewehr 43) and [[assault rifle]]s. 

Though battle rifles were highly supplanted in mainstream service by lighter assault rifles, many are still used in specialist roles (e.g. designated marksman) by many [[military|armed forces]] and police units.

title: anti-materiel_rifle
body:
A [[rifle]] that can be used against targets other than humans, such as parked aircraft, soft-skinned or lightly-armored vehicles, ammunition dumps, and the like. Usually has caliber of 12.7mm (.50) or larger.

They are essentially very large [[sniper rifle]]s. Though not specifically designed for anti-personnel use, they are sometimes used in that role.

title: sniper_rifle
body:
A high-precision [[rifle]] designed to accurately engage targets at long range, equipped with a [[scope|telescopic sight]] most of the time. Most modern sniper rifles feature a buttstock with adjustable length and cheekpiece position, as well as a (detachable) [[bipod]] for stability. Some of them fire specialized [[rifle cartridge|rounds]] such as the .338 Lapua Magnum, while many models share the same ammunition with the more common service rifles, such as 7.62×51mm NATO.

This tag also apply to World War II-era or earlier conventional full-length rifles with a long range scope, such as the [[Mosin-Nagant]].

title: rocket_launcher
body:
A [b]man-portable[/b] [[weapon]] that fires a rocket-propelled projectile at a target. This tag is a catch-all term for any types of them, including [[multishot rocket launcher]]s, man-portable air-defense systems (MANPADs), anti-tank systems, and more. Because missiles they fire are considered as guided rockets.

For tagging purpose and despite the technical distinctions, [b]recoilless rifle[/b] is aliased into rocket launcher due to identical external appearance of the specific models and the same purpose of both weapon classes.

See [[missile pod]] for [[military vehicle|vehicle]] mounted rocket and [[missile]] systems.

h4. List of rocket launchers

title: assault_rifle
body:
An infantry [[rifle]] designed for combat, with selective fire capability. The German [[StG44]] was the very first mass-produced assault rifle ever designed and introduced in battle.

In the strictest of definitions for a [[gun|firearm]] to be considered an assault rifle, it must at least follow these characteristics:
* It must be an individual weapon with provision to fire from the shoulder (i.e. a buttstock);
* It must be capable of selective fire (semi and full auto, some models may feature burst fire mode);
* It must have an [[rifle cartridge|intermediate-power cartridge]], which has more power and velocity than a pistol round but less than a standard full-power ones (i.e. 5.56×45mm NATO);
* Its [[ammunition]] must be supplied from a detachable box [[magazine (weapon)|]].

title: ase_kaichatta_ne_cesario_(vocaloid)
body:
[i]EN: You worked up quite the sweat there, [[Cesario (racehorse)|]].[/i]

Infamous [[Vocaloid]] song singing about making onigiri with sweat from Cesario the racehorse. Sung using [[Hatsune Miku]]'s voicebank.

The song was quite the meme during the old [[2channel|2ch]] and [[Niconico]] days, though it recently made a comeback because of the horse's [[Cesario (Umamusume)|Umamusume counterpart]] being announced, leading her to be strongly associated with onigiri, making them while sweating or just refering to the song while she's sweating or when eating an onigiri she has made.

h4. Lyrics

h6. Original JP

[quote]
9月だというのに
たくさん汗をかいた シーザリオ
またがっていた（またがっていた！）
僕の手にはびっしょりシーザリオの汗
両手を広げて吹かれる 時間を忘れた
手にできた結晶を
僕はおひつを開けて おにぎりを握った
おいしいね シーザリオ
[/quote]

h6. EN translation

[quote]
[i]Even though it's September
You worked up quite the sweat there, Cesario[/i]

[i]I sat astride you (astride you!)
With my hands drenched in Cesario's sweat[/i]

[i]I spread my hands with the wind blowing and forgot the time
The crystals I've got on my hands
I opened the rice container and made a rice ball
It sure is delicious, Cesario[/i]
[/quote]

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Original song":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3HIHDjYZOAc]
other_names: 汗かいちゃったね、シーザリオ
汗かいちゃったねシーザリオ

title: taiwan
body:
A country located on the titular island of Taiwan in East Asia. As a country, it was established by [[Chiang Kai-Shek]] and various [[Kuomintang]]-affiliated Chinese after the Republic of China was [[Chinese civil war|defeated]] by [[Mao Zedong]]'s [[china|Communist China]] and evacuated to the island. The state still serving as the continuity of the Republic of China and still using the same official name of "Republic of China" as when the state ruled mainland China.

The political status of Taiwan is complex, with the People's Republic of China claiming sovereignty over the island under the One-China Policy and refusing diplomatic relations with any country that officially recognizes Taiwan. Taiwan itself, meanwhile, is politically divided between the current ruling "Pan-Green Coalition" lead by the Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), which seeks to relinquish the claim on mainland China and officially become an independent country as Taiwan, and the "Pan-Blue Coalition" lead by the Kuomintang Party, which maintains its claim as the sole and legitimate government of the entirety of China.

This tag can be applied if the post features the [[Republic of China flag]], or features [[real world location]]s in Taiwan. Do not tag [[China]] on Taiwan-related posts unless that post also features the PRC's flag or locations, as well as a reference to the [[Chinese civil war]].

h4. See also

* [[China]] (People's Republic of China)
* [[Kuomintang]] - for posts about pre-1987 Republic of China
* [[Republic of China flag]] - flag of modern Taiwan and its mainland precursor.
* [[Taipei 101]]

title: techwear
body:
A futuristic style of [[streetwear]] that uses special fabric that favors functionality while being comfortable for everyday life. Techwear is usually made with [[monochrome|monochromatic]] colors.

A notable feature of techwear is featuring more [[pocket]]s, [[zipper|zippers]], and [[strap|straps]] than usual.

h4. See also
* [[cyber fashion]]
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: streetwear
body:
A style of trendy urban fashion, primarily based around comfortable yet stylish clothes, usually mixing athletic or casual wear with expensive brands and pieces.

Streetwear takes influence from several musical genres and urban subcultures, including [[hip hop]], [[surfing]], [[skateboarding]], and [[punk]]. Several designer brands have also found popularity in streetwear communities due their prevalence in rap music, most notably [[Gucci]], [[Balenciaga]], [[Louis Vuitton (brand)|]] and [[Supreme (brand)|]].

Fans of streetwear and its most popular brands are sometimes referred to as "Hypebeasts":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/hypebeast].

title: steampunk
body:
A genre of [[science fiction]] set in Victorian times when steam was the main source of machine power. Common visual elements include, but are not limited to:

* [[victorian|Victorian fashion]], especially [[top hat]]s and for women, [[corset]]s or elaborate [[gown]]s
* Accessories such as [[goggles]], [[pocket watch]]es, [[belt pouch]]es, and [[test tube]]s
* [[Machinery]] with [[industrial pipe]]s, [[steam]], and lots of [[gears]]

title: scene_fashion
body:
A fashion style similar to [[emo fashion]], but more colorful and over the top. It features many accessories in bright colors, cartoon designs, patterns, and a focus on fluffy, colorful hair. It draws inspiration from various j-fashion styles such as [[gyaru]], [[visual kei]] and [[decora]], and is associated with music such as crunkcore and post-hardcore.

Scene and emo are not mutually exclusive, and the two are often blurred, with this blur being referred to as "Scemo".

h4. Elements
Common clothing includes [[skinny jeans]], band [[t-shirt]]s and shirts with colorful cartoon designs, [[tutu]]s, [[plaid skirt]]s, [[animal hood]]s, fluffy or striped [[leg warmers]], and [[denim shorts]]. Footwear typically consists of either [[sneakers]] or [[boots]].

Accessories associated with the style are various [[piercing]]s, oversized chunky-framed [[glasses]] or [[sunglasses]], [[shutter shades]], [[studded belt]]s, [[neckerchief]]s, [[fingerless gloves]], big [[hair bow]]s, [[bead necklace]]s and [[bead bracelet|bracelets]], rubber [[wristband]]s, and [[tiara]]s.

Hair is often fluffy with a fringe bang that falls [[hair over one eye|over one eye]]. Some sections may be dyed with a [[raccoon tails (hairstyle)|repeating striped pattern]], or brightly colored [[streaked hair|streaks]]. When [[makeup]] is worn, it typically consists of thick black [[eyeliner]] and brightly colored [[eyeshadow]] and [[nail polish]].

Common visual motifs include [[gem (symbol)|]] shapes, patterns ([[checkered]], horizontal stripes, [[animal print]], [[plaid]]), [[dinosaur]]s, [[zombie]]s, [[rainbow]] colors, [[skull]]s, [[mustache]]s, and [[glitter]]. Cartoon characters are commonly incorporated into the style, with particularly popular ones being [[Hello Kitty (character)|]], [[GIR (Invader Zim)|]], [[Gloomy Bear]], and [[Domo-kun]].

h4. Examples

title: mod_fashion
body:
An "unconventionally modern" style of dress originating in England in the 1960s. Mod clothes leaned toward ultra-short and [[sleeveless]], and usually had bright colors and patterns. Popular styles were [[miniskirt]]s, jumpers, shift dresses, patent rain trenches, patent leather go-go boots, and [[pantyhose]]. A popular outfit was coordinating a ribbed knit [[turtleneck]] with a miniskirt with matching tights with [[knee boots]]. 

h4. See also

* [[vintage clothes]]
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mod (subculture)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mod_(subculture)]

title: submachine_gun
body:
A [b]submachine gun[/b] or SMG is a carbine-length, pistol-caliber [[gun|firearm]] that is capable of fully automatic fire. Early SMGs such as the [[MP18]] have rifle-like appearance. While more modern models do have features like [[folding stock]], pistol grip and a fire selector. The term "submachine gun" was coined by [[Thompson submachine gun|John T. Thompson]], to describe its design concept as an automatic [[weapon]] with notably less firepower than a [[machine gun]] (hence the prefix "sub-"). 

A subset of submachine gun is dubbed [b]machine pistol[/b], which are often used to describe a handgun with automatic fire capability (e.g. Glock 18C), or compact SMGs with [[handgun]]-like ergonomics (e.g. Micro Uzi).

title: jersey_maid
body:
An unconventional [[maid]] costume that utilizes a [[track suit]] or a [[track jacket]] as the base.

May be simply a longer jacket worn like a dress, a skirt and jacket combo, or a track pants + jacket set, but the costume needs some maid-like elements, like a [[maid apron]] or a [[maid headdress]].

h4. See also
* [[tenshi kaiwai]]
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: gyaruo
body:
The male counterpart to [[gyaru]]. While the term originated from the styles reported on by fashion magazine [i]Men's Egg[/i], it has since gone on to become a moniker for the youth subculture that wore it.

Like their female counterparts, typical gyaruo attire comes in different flavors. The most common depictions have [[tan]]s or [[dark skin]], [[blonde hair]], or some sort of loose fashion. However, not everyone who is tan or blond may be part of the gyaruo subculture.

Also spelled as "gyaru-oh" or "gal-o":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1EKTw50Uf8M] alternately. Due to their flashiness, 2010s japanese youth tend to associate them with the term "charao" (チャラ男).

As with their female counterpart, gyaruo were similary depicted as either an extroverted and often hot-headed douchebag in mainstream, or being a hypersexual who hits on many different women in erotic works.

h4. See also
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: amesuku_gyaru
body:
A type of [[kogal]] taken to the extreme: [[school uniform]]s characterized by [[tied shirt|tied]] [[open shirt]]s (exposing not just the [[midriff]], but the chest as well, showing off the [[bra]]/[[bikini]] underneath), and a short-enough [[skirt]] that [[panties]] may be [[pantyshot|revealed]], emphasizing the wearer's body. Paired with these are accessories and make-up.

Referred to as "American School" (or Amesuku) style in Japanese, based on what the Japanese think American girls would wear in high school, bolstered by gravure and AVs featuring the attire (potentially inspired by the outfit [[Britney Spears]] wore in "...Baby One More Time"). 

h4. See also
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

h4. External links

title: sakurai_momoka
body:
An [[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls]] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. She appeared in the Idolm@ster Cinderella Girls anime.

Momoka is a very elegant young 12 y.o. lady with a princess-like disposition, who acts very mature for her age. Her clothes tend to be very frilly and covered in flower motifs. She's from a wealthy upbringing.

In the tie in Cinderella Girls Theater skits, Momoka is a mature girl who appears to have a lady-like aura about her. While she often tries to act older than she is, Momoka still is a young girl at heart and is susceptible to things girls her age enjoy. She was scouted by considering herself the prize in the Production Match Festival. She regularly holds tea parties with the younger idols, and takes them very seriously. Her favorite tea seems to be “Rose Hip Tea”, although she can occasionally be distracted from it via the antics of her guests.

Momoka found a friend in [[Umeki Otoha]], as they both shared a similar demeanor. She appears to enjoy teasing [[Kamiya Nao]], as she notes Nao chooses her clothes and costumes with the Producer in mind. Momoka also really likes the glasses [[Kamijo Haruna]] gave her, and enjoys selecting kimonos with friends. She holds the Producer in very high regard and shows that she will put herself on the line in order to show him that she cares about him.

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the 8th CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Tachibana Arisu]], [[Ichinose Shiki]], [[Katagiri Sanae]], and [[Shiomi Syuko]].

Voiced by [[Terui Haruka]].

h4. Official art

h4. External links

title: heat_pad
body: A pad that serves to warm parts of the body. They may be disposable or re-usable. A well-known brand in Japan is called Cairo (カイロ), after the Egyptian capital, to the point where the word is synonymous with heat pad; this is much like how band-aid has become a genericized trademark for bandage in the US.

title: tupet
body: A juice drink contained inside a tube made from plastic. It's 'tu', not 'chu' or 'chew' because the name of the product is derived from the word チューブ (chuubu) - tube. Can also be frozen in the freezer and eaten as a frozen treat or a [[popsicle]]. In that case, the center of the container has been made smaller so it can be broken in half. This drink has a lot of similar products and other brand names. Tupet is the best known one (but not the first one). The other names include "Bou-juice (Stick-juice)" by Satou Seika, "[[Chu Chu Ice]]" by Alps Seika, "Pokkin Ice", "Pakkin Ice" and so on. Similar products outside of Japan include the Colombian "Bon-Ice". The manufacturer of tupets, MAEDA SANGYO Co.ltd, issued a voluntary recall of this product in 2009, saying, "We understand that there has been some concern for an outbreak of mold caused by a flaw in the manufacturing process." After that, the company stated that "In the end, we have identified that resolving this problem by improving our facilities/machines would cost too much time and money." and decided to discontinue the product. This drink has more than 30 years of history and many fans. The news of the discontinuation caused great sorrow among them. However, actually nobody was troubled because some similar products are still sold. h4. Variations in other countries United States: Freeze pop, Freezer pop, Icee; Otter Pops ©, Fla-Vor-Ice ©, Pop-Ice © United Kingdom: Ice pole, Ice pop; Mr. Freeze © Australia: Zooper Dooper © Philippines: Ice candy Spain: Polo Flash India: Sip Up h4. See also * [[Tag group:Food tags]] h4. External links * "Wikipedia (JP): チューペット":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/チューペット] * "Q&A site 'Oshiete goo': What do you call this popsicle? (JP)":http://oshiete.goo.ne.jp/qa/1615363.html

title: light_machine_gun
body:
A type of [[machine gun]] designed to be operated by a single person, with or without an assistant.

Early LMG designs were typically [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]-fed and they fire full-powered [[rifle cartridge]], such as the .303 British [[Bren lmg|Bren]]. Modern post-[[World War II]] designs fire intermediate [[ammunition|round]], and they can be either [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] or magazine-fed (e.g. the 5.56×45mm NATO [[M249 saw]]). They are also known as the [i]squad automatic weapon[/i].

Some LMGs are based on the existing service [[assault rifle|(assault) rifle]], such as the [[RPK]]. 

h4. List of light machine guns

A legendary [[idol]] during the [[Shouwa]] Era, she was killed in a plane crash in 1983 when she was 19 years old. She has been revived as a [[zombie]] by [[Tatsumi Koutarou]] to be part of the idol group Franchouchou.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[white hair]] that is tied into [[low twintails]], and she wears a navy blue [[sailor dress]]. As a zombie, she has [[red eyes]] and [[patchwork skin]].

Voiced by [[Kawase Maki]].

title: oiran
body:
A traditional Japanese courtesan in Edo (present-day Tokyo), the [i]Yoshiwara[/i]. They were a much higher-class subtype of [[yuujo]], the iconic feudal-era Japanese [[prostitution|prostitutes]]. 

Unlike [[yuujo]], oiran were more educated and cultured, and had talents beyond those used in the bedroom. This gave them a social standing which put them well above any common prostitute, even outside the red-light districts. The companionship of an oiran did not come cheaply, so their clientele were primarily men of high political or social ranking. 

Oiran should not be confused with [[geisha]], who tend to dress far less luxuriously and who do not provide any sexual services. After World War II, the geisha eventually ended up replacing the role of "classic, respectable female entertainer" that oiran had filled in Japanese society.

h4. See also

title: yamada_tae
body:
Out of the seven [[zombie|zombies]] of [[Zombie Land Saga]], she is the only that has yet to be awakened throughout the series (and thus remain unintelligible). Her voice actor wasn't revealed until the ending credits of the 3rd episode, in which she was revealed to be voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] and [[red eyes]] and wears a [[black dress]], with most of her body wrapped in [[bandages]].

title: mizuno_ai
body:
[[Zombie Land Saga]] character.

She was the leader of the idol group Iron Frill, which [[Minamoto Sakura]] was a fan of in life. However, like Sakura, she too died in 2008, [spoiler]with her cause of death being a freak lightning hitting her at a concert,[/spoiler] and eventually being revived by [[Tatsumi Koutarou]] as a [[zombie]] alongside Sakura.

She has a [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with multiple flowery [[hair ornament]] decorating it, and [[red eyes]]. Due to how she died, without her makeup she is wrapped in [[bandages]].

Voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]

title: nikaidou_saki
body:
[[Zombie Land Saga]] character. Saki was the special attack unit captain of Dorami, a bosozoku gang during the 1990s led by [[Kirishima Reiko (zombie land saga)|]]. She died in 1997 after [spoiler]she drove off a ledge in a game of chicken[/spoiler]. She later became revived as a [[zombie]] by [[Tatsumi Koutarou]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[orange hair|orange]] and [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], with the streaks likely being hair dye, given how Reiko had similar streaks when she was in Dorami but currently does not. Saki wears a [[letterman jacket]] and [[long skirt]].

She was a big fan of [[tamagotchi]] and [[drive-in tori]] when she was alive, and was thrilled when it was revealed she (and Franchouchou) was going to be featured in the latter's commercial.

Voiced by [[Tano Asami]].

title: minamoto_sakura
body:
[[Zombie Land Saga]] character. A 17-year-old who was killed after being hit by a mini truck in 2008.

Ten years later, she was resurrected as a [[zombie]] by [[Tatsumi Koutarou]]. Koutarou offered her to become the founding member of Koutarou's zombie idol group [i]Franchouchou[/i] and help him promote the Saga prefecture. Sakura accepted the deal with Koutarou to pursue her dream when she was alive: to became a great idol.

She has dark [[pink hair]] or [[red hair]] with a small [[one side up]] tied with a pink and green polka dot [[ribbon]] on the left side of her head. In her zombie form, she has a large [[scar]] on her forehead. Her original (human) eye color is [[blue_eyes|blue]], but it turned into [[red_eyes|red]] in her zombie form. She has [[medium breasts]] and is occasionally depicted as having [[large breasts]] in fanart.

Voiced by [[Hondo Kaede]].

body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] series. She first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]Elle Vianno[/b] is an energetic, [[blonde hair]]ed girl with a [[ponytail]] who is a member of [[Judau Ashta]]'s original gang of [[machinery]] scavengers. She later becomes part of the [[AEUG]] [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i], where she pilots the [[Gundam Mk II]] and its [[Super Gundam]] variant.

title: unworn_mask

title: yuki-chan_(yowamushi_pedal)
body: The younger cousin of [[midousuji_akira|Midousuji Akira]]. She has only been shown in flashbacks, so her aged up design is up to artist interpretation.

title: miguel_hidalgo
body: [b]Miguel Gregorio Antonio Ignacio Hidalgo-Costilla y Gallaga Mandarte Villaseñor[/b] (8 May 1753 – 30 July 1811), more commonly known as [b]Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla[/b] or simply [b]Miguel Hidalgo[/b], was a [[mexico|Mexican]] [[priest]] and one of the first and most important leaders of the Mexican War of Independence (1810–1821).

title: beecha_oleg
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986.

[b]Beecha Oleg[/b] is a member of [[Judau Ashta]]'s original gang of [[machinery]] scavengers. Beecha has [[freckles]] and orange long hair. He is usually seen by the side of [[Mondo Agake]]. 

Beecha later becomes part of the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i], where he pilots the now repaired [[Hyaku Shiki]].

title: guncannon_detector
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It was first introduced in [[Gundam MSV]] and later appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]MSA-005K Guncannon Detector[/b]

A ground artillery [[mobile suit]] for mid-range support, it was co-manufactured by Karaba, an [[AEUG]] support organization, and [[Anaheim Electronics]] during [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps Conflict]]. It used the movable frame of the AEUG MSA-005 [[Methuss]] as a base, and taking references from the old EFSF RX-77 [[Guncannon]], it has two Vulcan guns and a pair of [[beam cannon]]s. 

Despite this, the suit is not related to the Guncannon, its name was given by one of Karaba's leaders, [[Hayato Kobayashi]], who had piloted a Guncannon during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. Early Karaba/AEUG units were red colored, while later [[char's_counterattack|Londo]] [[gundam_unicorn|Bell]] [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] units were colored blue.
other_names: ガンキャノン・ディテクター

title: mashymre_cello
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]Mashymre Cello[/b] is a high ranking [[military]] officer in [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. His [[mecha]] of choice are the [[Galluss-J]], The [[Hamma Hamma]] and the [[Zaku III Custom]] [[mobile_suit|MS]]. [spoilers]A Haman Karn fanboy. While seeming ridicule at first (due to his many defeats against the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i]), he eventually is turned into a cyber-Newtype and becomes a very dangerous warrior and fearsome MS ace piloting the Zaku III Custom. Dies in combat after decimating several [[Doven Wolf]]s of [[Glemy Toto]]'s renegade faction (commanded by [[Rakan Dahkaran]]) all by himself.[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Illia Pazom]]

title: tachi_(weapon)
body:
A tachi (太刀) was a type of traditionally made Japanese [[sword]] (nihontō) worn by the [[samurai]] class of feudal [[Japan]]. The tachi style of swords preceded the development of the [[katana]] and were primarily used on horseback. 
Tachi and katana generally differ in:
* Curvature: tachi tend to be more curved (both hilt and blade).
* How they are worn: tachi is worn suspended from the belt with its [u]cutting edge downward[/u], while the katana is thrust through the belt with its [u]cutting edge upward[/u] ("see reference":https://www.touken-collection-nagoya.jp/app/uploads/2021/12/55a244760b2a34f0c4e0924f01547517.jpg).
* Length: tachi tend to be longer than the katana.
* Hilt: while katana always have a rayskin-wrapped hilt with silk overwrapping, tachi sometimes only have the rayskin wrapping, though this is far from universal.

h4.See also
* [[Chokutou]], straight swords, were also called tachi, but written as 大刀
* [[Kodachi]]
* [[Ootachi]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links
* "Touken Collection (JP): Difference between Tachi and Katana":https://www.touken-collection-nagoya.jp/touken-introduction/tachi-and-uchigatana/
* "Wikipedia: Tachi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tachi
* "Wikipedia (JP): Tachi":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/太刀

title: nosferatu_eine_symphonie_des_grauens
body: A German silent horror film released in 1922. It was originally going to be an adaptation of Bram Stoker's novel [i]Dracula[/i], but all the characters in the film were renamed to avoid copyright infringement, with Dracula himself known being [[Count Orlok]].
other_names: 吸血鬼ノスフェラトゥ

title: count_orlok
body: A vampire and central antagonist of the 1922 film [i][[nosferatu eine symphonie des grauens|Nosferatu]][/i]. He is technically [[Dracula]], as [i]Nosferatu[/i] was supposed to be an adaptation of Bram Stoker's classic novel at first, but the name was changed in the original film in an attempt to avoid copyright issues (with a later unauthorized edit once more renaming him, this time to Prince Wolkoff).

title: cats_are_liquid_(meme)
body:
[[Meme]] related to the idea that [[cat]]s are basically a liquid due to their flexibility. This typically involves cats literally made of liquid, cats fitting to containers that usually contain liquids such as [[cup]]s or [[bottle]]s, or cats being poured like a liquid.

Sometimes also applied to other creatures, usually directly juxtaposed with the phrase "X is/are liquid".

h4. See also
* [[cats are scared of cucumbers (meme)]]

title: arcade
body:
A place of wonder and merriment, based on various forms of coin-operated mechanical and electronic game machines. Most popular during the 1980's and 1990's as standalone establishments; now largely limited in the West to smaller areas within amusement parks. Still quite popular in Asia.

For the architectural feature by the same name, see [[arcade (architecture)]]. For the large stationary video game machine that is often seen inside an arcade, use [[arcade cabinet]].

title: octoling_girl
body:
The female [[Octoling player character]] from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series. Their male counterpart is the [[Octoling Boy]].

In [[Splatoon 3]], with the omission of gender-locked hair, the only canonical difference between male and female octolings is their eyebrows and eye mask markings. With eye masks, Octolings boys do not have an eyelash on the lower outer corners, whereas girls do. For differences in eyebrows between the genders, see below. Please note that these gender differences is subject to artstyle, and not always congruent with canon.

[expand= Gender comparison]
[b]"Classic" Style[/b]
* !asset #22622082: (F)
* !asset #22622096:  (M)
[b]"Slit" Style[/b]
* !asset #22622083: (F) 
* !asset #22622097: (M) 
[b]"Thick" Style[/b]
* !asset #22622085: (F)

title: octoling_boy
body:
The male [[Octoling player character]] from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series. Their female counterpart is the [[Octoling Girl]].

In [[Splatoon 3]], with the omission of gender-locked hair, the only canonical difference between male and female octolings is their eyebrows and eye mask markings. With eye masks, Octolings boys do not have an eyelash on the lower outer corners, whereas girls do. For differences in eyebrows between the genders, see below. Please note that these gender differences is subject to artstyle, and not always congruent with canon.

title: shingeki_no_kyojin
body:
[b]Shingeki no Kyojin[/b] (also known as [b]Attack on Titan[/b]) is a manga by [[Isayama Hajime]].

In an alternative past, humanity has been attacked by monstrous giants called [[titan_(shingeki_no_kyojin)|Titans]]. What remains of it has barricaded itself behind a 3-walled fortress-country, and any attempt at war against the Titans has ended with disastrous results. The Titans, however, were unable to breach the walls, and so humanity has lived in safety for a century. One day, 2 unusual Titans appear out of nowhere and destroy the gate of the outer wall. In the ensuing massacre, Eren Yeager sees his mother devoured before his eyes. Swearing to eradicate all Titans, he enlists in the army alongside his adopted sister Mikasa Ackerman and friend Armin Arlert.

Nominated for the 4th Manga Taishou Awards (2011) and winner of the 35th annual Kodansha Manga Award for Best Shounen, Nominated for the 16th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize (2012).

title: cardcaptor_sakura_clear_card_arc
body: The sequel to [[Cardcaptor Sakura]], written and illustrated by the manga group [[Clamp (circle)|]]. It focuses on [[Kinomoto Sakura]] in junior high school. The manga was serialized in Kodansha's Nakayoshi magazine between the July 2016 and January 2024 issues, with the chapters being collected in 16 volumes. A 22-episode anime television series adaptation produced by Madhouse, featuring the cast and staff from the original series, aired from January to June 2018, which loosely adapts the first 24 chapters.

title: cardcaptor_sakura
body:
A popular manga and anime created by [[CLAMP (circle)|]]. Known as Cardcaptors in America.

The story centers on  Kinomoto Sakura, an elementary school student who discovers magical powers after accidentally freeing a set of magical cards into the world; she must retrieve the cards to prevent catastrophe. Each of these cards grants different magical powers, and can only be activated by someone with inherent magical abilities. A sequel, [[Cardcaptor Sakura Clear Card Arc]], was released from 2016 until 2024.

For the complete list of characters, costumes and items, see the [[list of Cardcaptor Sakura characters]].

title: galaco
body:
galaco is the image character of "galaxias!", a music unit consisting of Shibasaki Ko (Japanese actor and singer), [[deco27|DECO*27]] and TeddyLoid.

Her [[VOCALOID]] voicebank was developed based on Ko's voice, and released for the VOCALOID3 engine by the YAMAHA Corporation. She was distributed first as an exclusive prize vocal and later commercially for Mac and PC. She also has a speech voicebank that runs on AITalk, the same engine used by [[VOICEROID]].

She has long [[blonde hair]], [[orange eyes]], with [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] bangs. She wears a dress, a [[crown]], and stylized [[belt]].

Her limited accessed [[galaco (prize)|Prize]] voicebank design is by [[kei (keigarou)|KEI]], it’s later replaced by her [[galaco (neo)|NEO]] voicebank with a new design by [[Tomioka Jirou]]. 

h4. Official art

* !post #3754818: [[galaco (prize)|Prize]]
* !post #1788899: [[galaco (neo)|NEO]]
* !post #7826098: [[galaco (white)|WHITE]]

title: hannibal_lecter
body:
The titular character of the Hannibal book series by Thomas Harris and their film and television adaptions. Hannibal is an extremely brilliant but mentally disturbed and cannibalistic serial killer infamous for eating his victims. The books describe him as having [[red eyes]] and "mid ray duplication polydactyly" ([[extra digits|two identical functioning middle fingers]]) on his left hand.

Portrayed by Sir [[Anthony Hopkins]] in most film adapations, such as [[The Silence of the Lambs]]. Portrayed by [[Mads Mikkelsen]] in the [[Hannibal (tv series)|]] NBC television series.
other_names: ハンニバル・レクター

title: neet
body:
An acronym for "Not currently engaged in Employment, Education or Training". Originated from the United Kingdom. The demographic prevalence of NEETs is a serious social problem in Japan (among other places), where the term is typically used in a derogatory manner.

The lack of gainful employment can lead a NEET to social withdrawal, thus becoming a [[hikikomori]]. However, it is important when tagging to note that NEET and hikikomori are distinct, if related concepts.

h4. See also

* [[hikikomori]]
* [[home security]]
* [[you work you lose]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: NEET":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NEET]

title: cinnamiku
body: Unofficial name for a design of [[Hatsune Miku]] featured in the limited-time menu and collection of goods at Hatsune Miku x Cinnamoroll Cafe, a collaboration event held from July 15th to August 14th, 2022. In this design, Miku has her twintails [[updo|folded up]] with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]]. Depending on the artist, the twintails may be attached as two [[double_bun|hair buns]], two [[hair rings]] or simply just folded in. She often appears together with [[Cinnamoroll]] from [[Sanrio]], who also has [[tied_ears|his ears tied up]] with a [[ear_bow|matching bow]] and occasionally [[hatsune_miku_(cosplay)|wears the same outfit as Miku]]. h4. See also * [[Cinnamiku hairstyle]] * [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]] h4. External links * "Sanrio Event Announcement":https://www.sanrio.co.jp/news/cn-hatsunemiku-cafe-20220711 * "The limited-time menu":https://twitter.com/Cinnamon_cafe_/status/1547741209653039104

title: wedge_heels
body:
[[High heels]] with a thick, raised sole at the back of the shoe, forming a wedge-shaped heel. Also known as [b]espadrilles[/b] or simply as [b]wedges[/b].

Unlike normal heels, the bottom of the shoe is flat, with no gap between the sole and the ground.

If the entire sole is thick, but the heel is thicker than the front, then both [[platform heels]] and [[wedge heels]] may apply.

h4. Examples

* !post #6785068
* !post #6818160

h4. See also

title: nicoseiga_sample
body:
An image sourced from nicoseiga that is sampled, and is not the original image.

Nicoseiga post pages have the following characteristics:

URL: http[i]:[/i]//seiga.nicovideo.jp/seiga/im<[b]image ID[/b]>
Preview: http[i]:[/i]//lohas.nicoseiga.jp/thumb/<[b]image ID[/b]>i?
Link: http[i]:[/i]//seiga.nicovideo.jp/image/source/<[b]image ID[/b]>
Fullsize: http[i]:[/i]//lohas.nicoseiga.jp/priv/.../.../<[b]image ID[/b]>

It is Danbooru policy to either replace samples or delete them. See [[image sample]] for more information.

h4. See also

* [[Bad Nicoseiga ID]]: for when any Nicoseiga post or picture are no longer publicly available
* [[MD5 mismatch]]: for when none of the sizes match Danbooru

title: yuuki_makoto_(persona_3)
body:
The silent male protagonist from [[Persona 3]].

Unlike the rest of S.E.E.S, he has the ability to perceive the [[Velvet Room]] and the "Wild Card" ability to use, draw, and fuse multiple Personas.

His name is Arisato Minato in the manga, Shiomi Sakuya in the stage play adaptation, and Yuuki Makoto in the anime movie. Among fans his nickname is Kitarou, because he resembles [[Kitarou]] from [[GeGeGe no Kitarou]] in his [[hair over one eye]].

Initial Persona: [[Orpheus (persona)|]] (male version)

h4. See also

* [[Shiomi Kotone]]

title: shiomi_kotone
body:
The female main character in the [[PlayStation Portable|PSP]] [[Persona 3 Portable|port]] of [[Persona 3]].  Not to be confused with a mere [[genderswap]] of the male protagonist [[Yuuki Makoto (persona 3)|]].

Nicknamed by some as "Hamu-ko"（ハム子）or "Kimiko" (公子) in wordplay from the last kanji character in "protagonist" (主人公). Also known as "Minako" (ミナコ) due to the name being a feminine version of the male protagonist's name in the manga adaptation. Her official name was first used in the official play adaptation, where she is the male protagonist's sister.

Initial Persona: [[Orpheus (persona)|]] (female version)

h4. See also

* [[Yuuki Makoto_(persona_3)|]]
