title: drop_trap
body:
A type of trap commonly used on hard to capture feral cats. It is a container, typically netting over a light frame, that is propped up on one side by a stick. A string is fastened to the stick, so it can be pulled by the trapper to cause the container to completely enclose the prey.

h4. See also

* [[pitfall]]
* [[bear trap]]

title: iori_junpei
body:
One of the members of S.E.E.S. from [[Persona 3]], Junpei is a class clown, never taking anything seriously and letting others do the heavy thinking, prefering to have fun instead. He is best friends with the silent protagonist [[Yuuki Makoto (persona 3)|]]. His usual attire is a blue jacket and cap.

Initial Persona: [[Hermes (Megami Tensei)]]
Ultimate Persona: [[Trismegistus]]

title: brilliant_pagoda_or_haze_castle
body:
連縁天影戦記 ("Len'en Ten'eisenki") ~ Brilliant Pagoda or Haze Castle
("Connecting Link: Heaven & Shadow War Record")

Forth game of the [[Len'en]] series, released June 4, 2015 as a trial. Unlike other shooting games, this one has a cell system, making a "you make your own adventure"-type of game. You go ether left or right to move the bottom bar to your direction. There are three colours in this bar: red (Haze), purple (Neutral) and white (Brilliant). Depending on this, you'll move to different cells, thus at the end you get different bosses on the same stage.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Houlen Yabusame]]/[[Enraku Tsubakura]]/[[shion_(len'en)|Shion]]
* [[Taira no Fumikado]]/[[Fujiwara no Iyozane]]/[[Umatachi Tsugumi]]
* [[Zuifeng Tenkai]]/[[Katano Sukune]]/[[Kitsugai Sese]]
* [[Shitodo Kuroji]]/[[Shitodo Hooaka]]/[[Shitodo Aoji]]

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Boss Haze route: [[Mitsumo]]
* Stage 1 Boss Neutral route: [[Kurohebi]] or [[Amanomiya Jun]]
* Stage 1 Boss Brilliant route: [[Shirami Souko]]
* Stage 2 Boss Haze route: [[Kesa Kujiru]]
* Stage 2 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Aoji]], [[Amanomori Shou]], or [[Umatachi Tsugumi]]
* Stage 2 Boss Brilliant route: [[Moritake Medias]]
* Stage 3 Boss Haze route: [[Azuma Kaisen]]
* Stage 3 Boss Neutral route: [[Fujiwara no Iyozane]], [[Kitsugai Sese]], or [[Celeritas Lumen]]
* Stage 3 Boss Brilliant route: [[Ooya Kunimitsu]]
* Stage 4 Boss Haze route: [[Ogata Garaiya]]
* Stage 4 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Hooaka]], [[Kokutenshi Hibaru]], or [[Adagumo no Saragimaru]]
* Stage 4 Boss Brilliant route: [[Kashiwagi Kaoru]]
* Stage 5 Boss Haze route: [[para_(len'en)|Para]]
* Stage 5 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Kuroji]], [[Katano Sukune]], or [[Taira no Fumikado]]
* Stage 5 Boss Brilliant route: [[Fujiwara no Shirogane no Sanra]]
* Stage 6 Boss Haze route: [[Taira no Chouki]]
* Stage 6 Boss Neutral: [[Houlen Yabusame]], [[Enraku Tsubakura]], [[Clause (len'en)|]], [[Adagumo no Yaorochi]], [[shion_(len'en)|Shion]], or [[Zuifeng Tenkai]]
* Stage 6 Boss Brilliant route: [[Ooama no Ake no Mitori]]
* Stage 6 Boss Hidden route: [[Kuzu Suzumi]]
* Extra Stage Boss Haze route: [[Ametsukana Yago]]

title: ore_to_kanojo_ga_maou_to_yuusha_de_seitokaichou
body:
A light novel by Aikawa Jou and illustrated by [[H2SO4]].  It was published by ASCII Media Works in May 2010 with strong initial sales.  It was recalled in June 2010 due to major plagiarism issues with portions of dialog taken from other works, such as [[Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu]].

The series takes place at a school for humans and non-humans with two opposing student councils, the Hero's student council and the Maou's student council.  The main character's childhood friend becomes the Hero, but somehow he ends up with the position of Maou.  He is now forced to conceal his identity as the Maou from his childhood friend.

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* [[Tozawa Koutarou]]
* [[Fushigino Alice]]

h6. Maou's Student Council (Demon King's)

* [[Kujouin Kagami]]
* [[Yukino (Ore to Kanojo ga Maou to Yuusha de Seitokaichou)|Yukino]]
* [[Boushi Yae]]
* [[Lily Lendbrum]]

h6. Yuusha's Student Council (Brave Warrior's)

* [[Moto Yuusha]]
* [[Kongou Musashi]]
* [[Mitsuba Kaede]]
* [[Kurono Magokoro]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): 俺と彼女が魔王と勇者で生徒会長":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/俺と彼女が魔王と勇者で生徒会長
other_names: 俺と彼女が魔王と勇者で生徒会長

title: mayo_chiki!
body:
A 2009 light novel series by Asano Hajime, with illustrations by [[Kikuchi Seiji]]. Also adapted into a manga by [[Umibouzu (niito)]], serialized in Media Factory's [i]Monthly Comic Alive[/i], a spin-off manga titled [i]Mayo Mayo![/i] (まよまよ!), serialized in Kadokawa Shoten's [i]Nyantype[/i], and a 2011 anime by Feel.

Gynophobic [[Sakamachi Kinjirou]]'s life becomes even more complicated when he discovers that [[Konoe Subaru]], butler to [[Suzutsuki Kanade]], daughter of their school's principal, is actually a [[reverse_trap|crossdressing girl]]. After being blackmailed by Kanade into keeping silent about her secret, Kinjirou becomes Subaru's confidant and her closest friend in school.

h4. Characters

* [[Konoe Subaru]]
* [[Masamune Usami]]
* [[Narumi Nakuru]]
* [[Sakamachi Kinjirou]]
* [[Sakamachi Kureha]]
* [[Suzutsuki Kanade]]

h4. External links

* "Official Light Novel Site":http://www.mediafactory.co.jp/bunkoj/mayochiki/
* "Official Anime Site":http://www.starchild.co.jp/special/mayochiki/
* "Wikipedia: Mayo Chiki!":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mayo_Chiki%21
other_names: 迷える執事とチキンな俺と

title: double_spoiler
body:
ダブルスポイラー ～ 東方文花帖 "Double Spoiler ~ Touhou Bunkachou"

Seventeenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, twelfth in the Windows generation, and fifth spinoff, as well as the second spinoff based on the mainstream danmaku format. Also known as "Touhou 12.5", released 14 March 2010 at Reitaisai 7.

The game marks the return of [[Shameimaru Aya]] on another round of picture-taking escapades, this time covering various characters from [[Mountain of Faith]] to [[Undefined Fantastic Object]], including recurring protagonists [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]], as well as characters introduced in the fighting spinoffs: [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Nagae Iku]] and [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] - but now with competition in the form of [[himekaidou_hatate|a rival journalist]].

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Shameimaru Aya]]
* [[Himekaidou Hatate]]

h5. Enemies

* Level 1: [[Aki Shizuha]] and [[Aki Minoriko]]
* Level 2: [[Mizuhashi Parsee]] and [[Kagiyama Hina]]
* Level 3: [[Kurodani Yamame]], [[Kisume]] and [[Tatara Kogasa]]
* Level 4: [[Kawashiro Nitori]] and [[Inubashiri Momiji]]
* Level 5: [[Kumoi Ichirin]] and [[Murasa Minamitsu]]
* Level 6: [[Ibuki Suika]] and [[Hoshiguma Yuugi]]
* Level 7: [[Toramaru Shou]] and [[Nazrin]]
* Level 8: [[Kaenbyou Rin]] and [[Reiuji Utsuho]]
* Level 9: [[Komeiji Satori]] and [[Komeiji Koishi]]
* Level 10: [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] and [[Nagae Iku]]
* Level 11: [[Yasaka Kanako]] and [[Moriya Suwako]]
* Level 12: [[Hijiri Byakuren]] and [[Houjuu Nue]]
* Level EX: [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* Level Spoiler (if playing as Aya): Himekaidou Hatate
* Level Spoiler (if playing as Hatate): Shameimaru Aya

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Double Spoiler":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Double_Spoiler

title: ten_desires
body:
東方神霊廟 ("Touhou Shinreibyou") ~ Ten Desires
("Divine Spirit Mausoleum")

Nineteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, thirteenth of the mainstream lineup, and fourteenth overall game of the Windows generation, as well as the eighth mainstream game of the same generation.

A large number of divine spirits are running free. Knowing this can't be left unchecked, [[Hakurei Reimu|Reimu]] decides to investigate. Joining as usual is [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]]. Intent on furthering her training, [[Kochiya Sanae]] joins once again, this time to achieve that goal by learning how to use these spirits more effectively. [[Konpaku Youmu]] also joins for the first time since [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]], so that she may deal with the spirits not under her control.

h4. Characters

h5. Heroines

* [[Hakurei Reimu]] 
* [[Kirisame Marisa]]
* [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* [[Konpaku Youmu]]

* Stage 1 Boss: [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] (reappearance)
* Stage 2 Midboss/Boss: [[Kasodani Kyouko]]
* Stage 3 Midboss: [[Tatara Kogasa]] (reappearance)
* Stage 3 Boss/Stage 4 Supporting Boss: [[Miyako Yoshika]]
* Stage 4 Midboss/Boss: [[Kaku Seiga]]
* Stage 5 Midboss/Final Stage Supporting Boss: [[Soga no Tojiko]]
* Stage 5 Boss/Final Stage Supporting Boss: [[Mononobe no Futo]]
* Final Stage Boss: [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]]
* Extra Stage Midboss: [[Houjuu Nue]] (reappearance)
* Extra Stage Boss: [[Futatsuiwa Mamizou]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Ten Desires":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Ten_Desires

title: yousei_daisensou
body:
妖精大戦争 ～ 東方三月精 ("Yousei Daisensou ~ Touhou Sangetsusei")
("Great Fairy Wars ~ Touhou Sangetsusei")

Eighteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, thirteenth in the Windows generation, sixth spinoff overall, and third spinoff based on the mainstream danmaku format. Numbered "Touhou 12.8" and released 14 August 2010 at Comiket 78.

The game is based on the [i]Sangetsusei[/i] manga series ([i]Eastern and Little Nature Deity[/i], [i]Strange and Bright Nature Deity[/i] and [i]Oriental Sacred Place[/i]), with artwork by [i]Sangetsusei[/i] artist [[Hirasaka Makoto]], making the game the first collaborative spinoff not involving Tasogare Frontier.

In her first-ever protagonist role, [[Cirno]] declares war on the Three Mischievous Fairies - [[Luna Child]], [[Sunny Milk]] and [[Star Sapphire]] - in their first in-game appearance.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Cirno]]

h5. Enemies

h6. Mid-boss

* [[Lily White]]
* [[Lily Black]]
* [[Daiyousei]]

h6. Boss

* [[Sunny Milk]]
* [[Luna Child]]
* [[Star Sapphire]]

h6. Extra Boss

* [[Kirisame Marisa]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Fairy Wars":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Fairy_Wars

title: kijin_seija
body:
The "Counterattacking Amanojaku."  Stage 5 midboss and boss, and stage 6 midboss, of [[Touhou]] [[Double Dealing Character]] and protagonist of [[Impossible Spell Card]].

She has the power to flip anything over, and has extreme contrarian tendencies; liking whatever others dislike, becoming unhappy whenever others are happy, saying the opposite of what she really means, and so on. She is the instigator of the plot of Double Dealing Character, manipulating [[Sukuna Shinmyoumaru]] into helping her create a world where the weak will rule over the strong.

She has two [[small horns|small]] [[grey horns|grey]] (or [[white horns|white]]) [[cone horns]] on the top of her head and [[short hair|short]] [[multicolored hair]] of [[black hair|black]], [[white hair|white]], and [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. She wears a [[multicolored dress]] of the [[white dress|same]] [[red dress|set of]] [[black dress|colors]] with an [[arrow print]] on the [[print dress|bottom]] and [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[blue bowtie]], a [[blue sash]] with a [[waist bow|bow]] on her [[back bow|back]], and [[sandals]].

h4. See also

* [[Nimble fabric]]
* "Touhou - God Damn It Seija!":/pools/7355 - A pool of Seija reversing things at the expense of other people.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Seija Kijin":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Seija_Kijin

title: nimble_fabric
body:
The [[purple]] [[checkered]] [[fabric]] that [[Kijin Seija]] uses as a tool in [[Impossible Spell Card]]. It allows Seija to briefly hide in the nimble, becoming invincible but immobile and harmless.

It is a parody of [[Doraemon]]'s "Hirari Mantle":[https://strategywiki.org/wiki/Doraemon/Items#Shooter_items].

title: impossible_spell_card
body:
弾幕アマノジャク ("Danmaku Amanojaku") ～ Impossible Spell Card

The 14.3rd official installment of the [[Touhou]] games, featuring [[Kijin Seija]] as the protagonist. The game was released 11 May 2014, at Reitaisai 11. As the title implies, it is a spinoff game consisting mostly of spell cards that would be impossible (or nearly impossible) to beat in regular [i]Touhou[/i] games, but the player disposes of various "cheat items", each with its particular ability, as a help to defeat the enemies.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Kijin Seija]]

h5. Enemies
* Day 1: [[Tsukumo Yatsuhashi]], [[Wakasagihime]] and [[Cirno]]
* Day 2: [[Kasodani Kyouko]] and [[Sekibanki]]
* Day 3: [[Imaizumi Kagerou]], [[Kamishirasawa Keine]] and [[Fujiwara no Mokou]]
* Day 4: [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]], [[Kaku Seiga]] and [[Miyako Yoshika]]
* Day 5: [[Horikawa Raiko]], [[Tsukumo Benben]] and [[Tsukumo Yatsuhashi]]
* Day 6: [[Futatsuiwa Mamizou]], [[Shameimaru Aya]], [[Himekaidou Hatate]], [[Kawashiro Nitori]] and [[Inubashiri Momiji]]
* Day 7: [[Kirisame Marisa]], [[Izayoi Sakuya]], [[Konpaku Youmu]] and [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* Day 8: [[Sukuna Shinmyoumaru]], [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Futatsuiwa Mamizou]]
* Day 9: [[Yasaka Kanako]], [[Moriya Suwako]], [[Mononobe no Futo]] and [[Ibuki Suika]]
* Day 10: [[Hijiri Byakuren]], [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]], [[Hinanawi Tenshi]], [[Remilia Scarlet]] and [[Yakumo Yukari]]

h4. See also

* [[Nimble Fabric]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Impossible Spell Card":http://en.touhouwiki.net/Impossible_Spell_Card

title: strange_creators_of_outer_world
body:
An official [[Touhou]] magazine which began on 30 September 2015 and is published every three months by Kadokawa under the Dengeki Moeoh imprint. [i]Touhou[/i] creator [[ZUN]] has full supervision of the project. The magazine provides information to new fans of the series, introductions and interviews with creators of [i]Touhou[/i] doujin works and continues the print series [[Curiosities of Lotus Asia]].

h4. External links

* "Official Website (Japanese)":http://tohogairai.dengeki.com/

title: immaterial_and_missing_power
body:
東方萃夢想 ("Touhou Suimusou") ~ Immaterial and Missing Power
("Gathering Dreams in the East")

Eighth game in the [[Touhou]] series, third in the Windows generation, and first spinoff, as well as the first fighting spinoff made in collaboration with Tasogare Frontier. Labeled as "Touhou 7.5".

An incessant occurrence of feasts began troubling residents of [[Gensokyo]], thus only 3 days before another such feast occurs, 6 girls decide to investigate and filter out the source - a [[ibuki_suika|party-loving oni]] who hopes that the feasts finally lure her fellow oni out of centuries of hiding underground.

title: imperishable_night
body:
東方永夜抄 ("Touhou Eiyashou") ~ Imperishable Night
("Eternal Night Vignette from the East")

Ninth game of the [[Touhou]] series, eighth of the mainstream lineup, and fourth of the Windows generation, as well as the third mainstream game in the same generation.

On the eve of the Harvest Moon Festival in [[Gensokyo]], youkai sense that the moon has been stolen and replaced with a false one. Someone must freeze time and find the real moon to ensure a full moon on the night of the festival. To this end, a pair of a human and a youkai (4 pairs in total) go in search of the real moon, leading them to a [[yagokoro_eirin|genius pharmacist]] and her charge, the [[houraisan_kaguya|exiled princess of the Moon]].

h4. Characters

title: phantasmagoria_of_flower_view
body:
東方花映塚 ("Touhou Kaeizuka") ~ Phantasmagoria of Flower View
("Oriental Flower Viewing Mound")

Tenth game in the [[Touhou]] series, ninth in the mainstream lineup, fifth in the Windows generation, and fourth mainstream game in the same generation.

An unusual spring has befallen in [[Gensokyo]] - flowers from all seasons start blooming at the same time. Various girls, with various reasons, wander around gathering clues in search of a solution, one which will lead them to a [[onozuka_komachi|lackadaisical shinigami]] and her [[Shiki Eiki|busybody employer]].

The game features the "versus system" introduced in the PC-98 generation's [[Phantasmagoria of Dim.Dream]].

Notorious for its manual, which gave Cirno her nickname "[[circled 9|⑨]]".

h4. Characters

h5. Initial

* [[Hakurei Reimu]]
* [[Kirisame Marisa]]

title: mountain_of_faith
body:
東方風神録 ("Touhou Fuujinroku") ~ Mountain of Faith
("Chronicles of the Wind God of the East")

Twelfth game in the [[Touhou]] series, tenth in the mainstream lineup, and seventh in the Windows generation, as well as the fifth mainstream game in the same generation.

One autumn, a [[kochiya_sanae|mysterious stranger]] approaches the Hakurei Shrine and orders it closed to make way for the Moriya Shrine atop Youkai Mountain. A displeased [[Hakurei Reimu]] and a bored [[Kirisame Marisa]] decide to enter Youkai Mountain - a place forbidden to humans - to confront the [[yasaka_kanako|new goddess]] atop the mountain.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Hakurei Reimu]]
* [[Kirisame Marisa]]

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Midboss: [[Aki Shizuha]]
* Stage 1 Boss: [[Aki Minoriko]]
* Stage 2 Midboss/Boss: [[Kagiyama Hina]]
* Stage 3 Midboss/Boss: [[Kawashiro Nitori]]
* Stage 4 Midboss: [[Inubashiri Momiji]]
* Stage 4 Boss: [[Shameimaru Aya]] (reappearance)
* Stage 5 Midboss/Boss: [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* Final Stage Boss/Extra Stage Midboss: [[Yasaka Kanako]]

title: hidan_no_aria
body:
An ongoing 2008 light novel series by Akamatsu Chuugaku and illustrated by [[Kobuichi]], with an ongoing 2009 manga adaptation illustrated by [[Koyoka Yoshino]], a spring 2011 anime adaptation by [[J.C. Staff]], and an ongoing 2010 spinoff manga [[Hidan no Aria AA]] illustrated by Tachibana Shogako, with its own anime adaptation by J.C. Staff. 

On the way to school, [[Tooyama Kinji]], a student of Tokyo Butei High, a prestigious school which trains youths to become "Butei" - armed civilian law enforcers - nearly fell victim to a serial bomber known as the "Butei Killer", were he not saved by [[kanzaki h. aria|Kanzaki H. Aria]], his diminutive schoolmate and an elite gunner/swordsman. Despite his misgivings about his life as a Butei, Kinji nevertheless joins her in hunting down the "Butei Killer" before more of their schoolmates are endangered.

title: a_song_of_ice_and_fire
body:
A high fantasy novel series by American author [[George R.R. Martin]], running since 1996 with five novels (out of a projected seven) as of 2012.

The saga revolves around three interconnected stories, set in a world where summer and winter can last decades: a seven-way war for the throne of Westeros, a looming threat of supernatural beings from beyond a massive wall of ice as a long winter approaches, and an exiled princess' quest to retake Westeros from the usurpers who killed her father.

The saga is unique among its genre for its impartial third-person point-of-view provided by dozens of characters of differing allegiances and personalities, as well as toning down the genre's more fantastic elements in favor of battles, political intrigue and moral ambiguity.


h4. Books 

* 1: "A Game of Thrones":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Game_of_Thrones (August 1996) 
* 2: "A Clash of Kings":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Clash_of_Kings (February 1999) 
* 3: "A Storm of Swords":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Storm_of_Swords (November 2000) 
* 4: "A Feast for Crows":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Feast_for_Crows (November 2005) 
* 5: "A Dance with Dragons":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Dance_with_Dragons (July 2011) 
* 6: The Winds of Winter (TBA) 
* 7: A Dream of Spring (TBA) 

h4. See also 

* [[Game of Thrones]] - The television adaptation of the novel
* [[House of the Dragon]] - The television adaptation of the Targaryen civil war Dance of the Dragons

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: A Song of Ice and Fire":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Song_of_Ice_and_Fire 
* "A Wiki of Fire and Ice":http://awoiaf.westeros.org/

title: john_glenn
body:
[b]John Herschel Glenn Jr.[/b] (July 18, 1921 – December 8, 2016)

American military officer, [[astronaut]] and politician. A United States [[Marine Corps]] fighter pilot in [[World War II]] and the Korean War. Chosen as one of the Mercury Seven, the first American astronauts. Became the first American to orbit the Earth on 20 February 1962 aboard the spacecraft [i]Friendship 7[/i]. Was elected to the US Senate representing the state of Ohio from 1974 through 1999. On 29 October 1998, he returned to space aboard the [[Space Shuttle]], becoming the oldest man to orbit the Earth.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: John Glenn":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Glenn

title: alice_(megami_tensei)
body:
[i]"A ghost who appears as a small blonde girl. She seems young, but her magic powers are formidable. She is either the ghost of an English girl who died a sad death, or an evil spirit from a fevered writer's mind."[/i]
    —Devil Survivor 2 Compendium 

A recurring demon in the [[Megami_Tensei|Megami Tensei]] series, she is the spirit of a young girl. Her design and abilities are inspired by the titular character of  [[alice (alice in wonderland)|Alice in Wonderland,]] while her personality derives from a spirit of European folklore, who is said to "befriend" misbehaving children by killing them. In the series, she will often ask the player to be her friend by "dying for her."

In [[Shin Megami Tensei I]], she takes the role of an NPC character; a deceased child who was resurrected by [[nebiros_(megami_tensei)|Nebiros]] and [[Belial_(megami_tensei)|Belial]], aka "Uncle Black" and "Uncle Red."

h4. See also

title: barioth
body:
A flying [[wyvern]] from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series.

The Ice Fanged Wyvern, Barioth, is a large white quadrupedal dragon that exhibits cat-like characteristics. It's very well adapted to the freezing environment of the tundra, where it preys on the [[Popo]] that live there. Featured prominently are Barioth's two large amber tusks, and its well developed forearms, adorned with large claws that help it move quickly across the ice. It is also capable of firing ice chunks at its foes that can cause severe cold.  

First introduced in [[Monster Hunter 3]], a brown subspecies better adapted to life in the desert was introduced in [[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]].

It's [[Barioth (Armor)|armor set]] is very popular amongst fans, being one of the most prominent after the [[Kirin (Armor)|Kirin]] set.

h4. See also

* [[Barioth (Armor)]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Barioth":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Barioth

title: tigrex
body:
A pseudowyvern from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series and flagship monster of [[Monster Hunter Portable 2nd]].

The Tigrex, also known as the "Roaring Wyvern", resembles a quadripedal [[tyrannosaurus rex]] with wings protruding from its forelegs and yellow-and-blue striped scales. It primarily lives on the desert, though also known to migrate to mountains to feast on [[popo|Popos]].

The Tigrex are notorious for their sheer ferocity and agility, using their jaws, claws and tail to destroy their enemies, as well as a roar that can damage and blow away any enemy who comes too close.

[[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]] introduces a black subspecies suited for life on volcanoes and with an even greater ferocity.

h4. See also

* [[Tigrex (armor)]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Tigrex":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Tigrex

title: rathian
body:
A flying [[wyvern]] from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series.

Rathian are large, green, fire-breathing dragons known as the Queen of the [[Wyvern|Wyverns]]. All are female, the males are called [[Rathalos]]. Unlike Rathalos, Rathian fight primarily on the land, using fireballs and venomous spines that cover their backs and the end of their tails. They're often inhabit forests, swamps, and deserts environments.

There are two subspecies; the Pink Rathian, a pink variant, and the Gold Rathian, a rare variant with a golden sheen. Originally appearing in [[Monster Hunter G]], they have both reappeared in [[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]] and in [[Monster Hunter 3 G]]. A third, black subspecies has been introduced for [[Monster Hunter Frontier]], as well.

h4. See also

* [[Rathian (Armor)]]
* [[Rathalos]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Rathian":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Rathian

title: rathalos
body:
A flying [[wyvern]] from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series.

Rathalos are large, red, fire-breathing dragons known as the King of the [[Wyvern|Wyverns]]. All are male, the females are called [[Rathian]]. Unlike Rathian, Rathalos fights mostly from the air, has poisonous talons, and is able to shoot fireballs while in flight. They're often found in wooded and volcanic regions.

The flagship monster for the first game in the series, it has appeared in every game since, and often represents the series in crossovers such as those in [[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]] and [[Dragalia Lost]].

There are two known subspecies; the Azure Rathalos, a blue variant, and the Silver Rathalos, a rare variant with a metallic silver sheen. Originally appearing in [[Monster Hunter G]], they have both made a reappearance in [[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]] and in [[Monster Hunter 3 G]].

h4. See also

* [[Rathalos (Armor)]]
* [[Rathian]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Rathalos":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Rathalos

In 2034, the idol industry is in a slump after the disappearance of the legendary unit "7th Sisters." As the new leader of the idol studio "777," aka Nanastar, you seek to bring new idols to fame.

title: aoki_hagane_no_arpeggio
body:
A sci-fi seinen manga series by [[Ark Performance]] and published in Young King Ours.

The series revolves around the crew of the submarine [[I-401 (aoki hagane no arpeggio)|]], a sentient ship that has rebelled against the mysterious navy, known as the Fleet of Fog that is composed of naval vessels that possess weapons and armor that completely outmatches those possessed by humans. The Fleet of Fog in 2039 took control of the seas around the world and cut off transport between continents and islands by all means except expensive SSTO (single-stage-to-orbit) space vehicle launches. The series begins in 2056 with the I-401 and its crew requested to protect a Japanese SSTO launch from the Fleet of Fog.

A 12-episode CG anime adaptation of the series titled Arpeggio of Blue Steel -Ars Nova- aired Fall 2013. A spin-off manga titled ソルティ・ロード (Salty Road) by TALI, author of 6 no Trigger, began publication October 2014

title: takao_(aoki_hagane_no_arpeggio)
body:
A character from [[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] blue to light [[blue hair]], normally in a [[ponytail]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her standard outfit is a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] with [[black pantyhose]] and a [[black choker]].

Takao is the mental model, a [[personification]], of the Fleet of Fog heavy cruiser Takao.  The heavy cruiser is either modeled after or is a resurrection of the World War 2 Japanese Takao-class heavy cruiser Takao. She is also famously [[tsundere]], having gained the in-series nickname "Tsundere Heavy Cruiser".

h4. External links

* "Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio Wiki: Takao":http://aokihagane.wikia.com/wiki/Takao
* "Wikipedia: Japanese Cruiser Takao":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_cruiser_Takao

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[short twintails|short]] [[twintails]] [[short hair with long locks|and very long]] [[sidelocks]], [[red eyes|red]] or [[brown eyes]], and wears a [[purple dress]], [[choker]] and [[pantyhose]].

Kongou is the mental model, a [[personification]], of the Fleet of Fog battleship Kongou.  The battleship is either modeled after or is a resurrection of the World War 2 Japanese battleship Kongou.

title: lagiacrus
body:
A leviathan [[monster]] from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series.

Known as the Lord of the Seas, the Lagiacrus is a species of large, blue, aquatic [[monster]] that dwell in the sea and large bodies of fresh water. It's capable of generating electricity through the dermal spikes on it's back and unleashing it in the form of devastating Thunder attacks. It's also known to come onto dry land to sunbathe and rest. While most at home in the sea, it's more than capable of defending itself on land.

Lagiacrus is the flagship monster of [[Monster Hunter 3]], where it was first introduced. Despite this, it did not appear in [[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]]. It is, however, set to reappear in [[Monster Hunter 3 G]], in addition to a white subspecies.

h4. See also

* [[Lagiacrus (Armor)]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Lagiacrus":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Lagiacrus

It's a giant, [[floating]], [[bloodshot eyes|bloodshot]] [[eyeball]] with [[bat wings]], a [[halo]], and [[tentacles]]. Extra Stage boss in [[Story of Eastern Wonderland]].

title: andrew_cunningham
body:
A senior [[Royal Navy]] officer who served with distinction through two World Wars, primarily in [[World War II]].

In 1936, he was promoted to vice-admiral, and in 1937 was made second-in-command of the Mediterranean Fleet aboard HMS [i]Hood[/i]. Three years later, he was made full commander in chief of the same Mediterranean Fleet aboard HMS [i]Warspite[/i] and led it through the naval battles of Calabria (July 1940) and Cape Matapan (March 1941). He was also responsible for the night air raid on Taranto (November 1940) that heavily damaged three Italian battleships (and may have even influenced Japanese plans for Pearl Harbor).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Andrew Cunningham, 1st Viscount Cunningham of Hyndhope":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Cunningham,_1st_Viscount_Cunningham_of_Hyndhope]
other_names: アンドリュー・ブラウン・カニンガム

title: ushizaki_urumi
body: Parental Guardian of Ancient Fish The second stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is an 牛鬼 (ushi-oni or gyuuki), a cow-demon youkai, and has [[cow horns]] atop her [[black_hair|black]] and [[grey_hair|grey]] [[two-tone hair]]. She wears a [[cow print|cow-printed]] [[haori]] over her [[crop top]] and [[yellow shorts]]. She also wears a pair of [[sandals]]. Her ability is to manipulate the weight of everyday objects, which she once used to increase the weight of the baby statue she holds to drown people. She now lives peacefully by the Sanzu River, where she runs a fishing business, and tries to help people who accidentally come to the river. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Urumi Ushizaki":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Urumi_Ushizaki

title: joutouguu_mayumi
body: Haniwa Lance Corporal The fifth stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is an [[armor|armored]] [[haniwa_(statue)|haniwa]] who leads the Haniwa army of [[Haniyasushin Keiki|Keiki]]. She is skilled in combat arts and can convert loyalty into strength. She wears her [[blonde hair]] in [[double bun|double buns]] with a [[white ribbon| white]] [[hair ribbon]], and is often depicted holding a [[haniwa_(statue)|haniwa]] as a weapon. She wears a plate of [[japanese_armor|armor]] and a pair of [[bloomers]]. h4. See also * pool #18399 - That's not how you use a Haniwa! h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Mayumi Joutouguu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mayumi_Joutouguu

title: armlock
body:
The act of locking another persons arms above their head. In short terms, it is a move where you lock another persons arms in place. It looks a bit similar to a [[full nelson]], but unlike where a full nelson, you don't grab the neck when you perform an armlock. Do not confuse this with holding arms, which is simply put any the act of holding another person's arms.

h4. See Also
* [[locked arms]]
* [[holding back]]

title: hecatia_lapislazuli
body:
[[Touhou]] character.

Based on the Greek goddess Hecate, Hecatia is a goddess who governs the Hells of the Earth, Moons and Otherworlds.  Like [[Junko (Touhou)|]], she also has a grudge against Chang'e, whose husband shot down Apollo and indirectly weakened Hell, as Hell wouldn't be able to exist without the sun. She's friends with Junko, and lent her [[Clownpiece]], her subordinate, to fulfill her plans.

She has [[red hair]], [[red eyes]] and wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[t-shirt]] (that is sometimes depicted as a [[crop top]]) along with a tri-colored [[plaid skirt]] of [[green skirt|green]], [[red skirt|red]], and [[blue skirt|blue]], and a [[black hat]]. She also carries ornaments of [[Moon (ornament)| the moon]], [[Earth (ornament)| the Earth]], and [[underworld (ornament)|the Spirit World]] with her, representing her ability to exist in 3 locations at once. Her hair and eye color change according to the ornament she wears in her hat: red when it's the Spirit World, [[blue hair|blue]] when it's [[Hecatia Lapislazuli (Earth)|Earth]], and [[blonde hair|blonde]] when it's the [[Hecatia Lapislazuli (Moon)|moon]], although it's not uncommon to see her with "other objects on her head.":/pools/10382

Her fashion sense has earned her the nickname "Hot Topic-chan":/pools/10945 among fans.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6753478: Default
* !post #3477315: [[hecatia lapislazuli (earth)|Earth body]]
* !post #3118168: [[hecatia lapislazuli (moon)|Moon body]]
* !post #5826588: All three bodies

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hecatia Lapislazuli":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hecatia_Lapislazuli

title: niwatari_kutaka
body: Clerical God of Hell's Checkpoint The third stage boss and extra stage midboss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. Originally a Niwatarijin, god of feral/wild chickens, she currently sorts out humans and oni souls in Hell. She has the ability to heal throat illnesses. Kutaka has a small [[chick]] [[bird_on_head|perched atop]] of her [[blonde_hair|light yellow]]-[[red_hair|red]] [[two-tone hair]]. She has two large [[bird wings]] and a long [[bird tail]]. She wears a [[white shirt]] atop her [[orange dress]]. In [[sunken fossil world|Gouyoku Ibun]], she has a [[whistle]]. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Kutaka Niwatari":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kutaka_Niwatari

title: nippaku_zanmu
body: King of the Silent Bliss of Nirvana First appeared in [[Touhou]] [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]] as the main antagonist, final boss for most routes, and playable character. Based on the Sengoku Era monk Nichihaku Zanmu, Zanmu is a human monk who turned into an oni. As an oni, she became one of Hell's most influential voices, being the one to propose the separation of Former Hell and New Hell. She has [[red eyes]], [[long_hair|long]], [[black hair]] with [[small horns|small]] [[yellow horns]]. She wears a [[green shirt]] and [[blue shorts]] with [[flip-flops]]. In UDoALG, she masterminded the events of the game in order to prevent the Animal Realm yakuza from triggering a total surface war with the Hell oni. By biding their time, the incident where the relinquished ownership rights of the surface naturally resolved itself. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Zanmu Nippaku":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Zanmu_Nippaku

title: himemushi_momoyo
body: Onyx Dragon-Eater Extra boss of [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. An oomukade (“giant centipede”) capable of eating dragons. Momoyo has [[long_hair|long]], [[messy_hair|messy]] [[grey hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. She carries a [[gold]] [[holding_pickaxe|pickaxe]] on her left and a [[gold]] [[holding_shovel|shovel]] on her right. She wears a [[skirt_set|matching]] [[shirt]] and [[skirt]] combo, and goes [[barefoot]]. Her limbs are adorned with many [[orange_bow|orange bows]], while her clothes have many [[ring|rings]] attached to them. A dragon-slaying centipede princess, she was approached by Megumu for a job mining the dragon gems. Unusually among Touhou characters, she refers to herself with the masculine personal pronoun "ore". Also notable is how she is one of the few characters in the series without a hat or head accessory. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Momoyo Himemushi":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Momoyo_Himemushi

body:

body: Genuine Magatama-Producing Craftsman The 4th stage boss of [[Touhou]] [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. She makes [[magatama]], and crafted [[Hakurei Reimu]]’s [[Yin Yang Orb]]s. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[two-tone hair]], [[blonde_hair|blonde]] and [[brown hair|brown]]. She wears [[patterned clothing|patterned]] and [[multicolored clothes]], divided in a [[yellow_skirt|yellow]] [[medium_skirt|medium-length]] [[skirt]] and a [[red shirt]] with [[short puffy sleeves]], tied with a [[sash]]. She also wears whiteish-purple [[earrings]] identical to her [[headpiece]], going around [[barefoot]]. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Misumaru Tamatsukuri":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Misumaru_Tamatsukuri

title: yamashiro_takane
body: Business Youkai of the Mountain's Recess The 2nd stage boss in [[Touhou]] [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. She is a yamawaro (a cousin species to the [[kappa]] that live in the mountains) capable of manipulating forest qi. The yamawaro and the kappa have maintained a healthy rivalry, so she is often seen with [[Kawashiro Nitori]]. She has [[medium_hair|medium]] [[green hair]] (although sometimes cut [[short_hair|shorter]] to make her look like Nitori), covered by a [[green headwear|darker green]] or [[blue_headwear|blueish]] [[flat_cap|cap]]; a [[green_dress|green]] [[camouflage|camouflage-colored]] [[skirt set]], a brown [[backpack]] hold tight by some strings attached to a [[key]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Takane Yamashiro":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Takane_Yamashiro

title: komakusa_sannyo
body: Highland-Dwelling Yamajorou The 3rd stage boss in [[Touhou]] [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. She is a yamajorou who can manipulate others with [[tobacco]] [[smoke]]. She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] arranged in a [[ponytail]], hold in place by a [[yellow_ribbon]]; she wears a closed [[red kimono]] (often drawn [[open clothes|a bit more open]] to [[revealing_clothes|expose]] either just the [[cleavage]] or more of the [[breasts]]) with [[wide sleeves]], and a [[purple skirt|purple]] [[medium skirt|skirt]], both [[torn clothes|torn]] at some areas; wears [[geta]] in her feet. In her right hand she hold her [[kiseru]] (emiting smoke in the shape of a [[dragon]]), and in her left hand she holds a [[folded fan|closed]] yellow [[hand fan]]. One of the few Windows-era characters to actually wear complete [[japanese clothes]] canonically. Often joked as a duplicate or daughter of [[Watatsuki no Yorihime]] due to her appearance, or as herself as owner of a casino/brothel. What comes from her kiseru is also subject of jokes, either it is [[marijuana|cannabis]] or [[opium]]. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Sannyo Komakusa":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Sannyo_Komakusa

title: mardock_scramble
body:
A 2003, three volume cyperpunk scifi novel series by "Ubukata Tow":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tow_Ubukata.

In 2010, it was adapted into an manga series and an anime movie series, that as of 2011 has 2 films out (Mardock Scramble: The First Compression and Mardock Scramble: The Second Combustion).

The series is about a 15-year-old girl named [[Rune Balot]], who had been taken in by a man named Shell Septinos. At the start of the series Shell attempts to kill Rune Balot, slitting her throat and leaving her for dead in a burning car. She is rescued by the private investigator Dr. Easter and his partner, an intelligent synthetic mouse, named [[OEufcoque|Œufcoque]]. To save her life, they performed a normally illegal procedure that replaced the entire skin of her body with a synthetic skin. This skin ends up granting her super human abilities, being able to completely sense her surroundings without sight and granting her the ability to manipulate electronics around her.

h4. Characters

* [[Rune Balot]]
* [[OEufcoque]]
* [[Tweedledee_(mardock_scramble)|]]
* [[Tweedledum_(mardock_scramble)|]]

h4. External links

She is of mixed heritage and possesses [[pointy ears]] from her [[elf]] blood.  She initially has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]], but due to events her hair ends up becoming [[white hair|white]].

title: mackintosh_rose
body:
A [[rose]] that is drawn as if looking at it [[from above]], with all its petals closely bound to one another, their edges overlapping.

The design was created by Scottish architect and artist Charles Rennie Mackintosh.

Because it closely follows [[art nouveau]] themes, the Mackintosh Rose differs from the [[stenciled rose]] in many ways. The flower is often closer to budding than being in full bloom, which causes the overall shape of the flower to be more circular. Additionally, the wedges representing the petals are more tightly wrapped and have a more similar crescent-like shape.

[[Ginrei (giant robo)|]] from [[Giant Robo]] has this design on the breast of her [[China dress]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #22620078

h4. See also

* [[art nouveau]]
* [[stenciled rose]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Charles Rennie Mackintosh":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Rennie_Mackintosh

title: gashadokuro
body:
A mythical giant [[skeleton]] in modern Japanese mythology.

Gashadokuro, also known as Odokuro, or ("starving skeleton") are giant skeletons that are fifteen times taller than an average person. If a Gashadokuro sees a human, it will grab it and attempt to bite its head off with its giant teeth. Gashadokuro are created from gathering bones from people who have died of starvation. The only way a Gashadokuro can be detected before it appears is by hearing a ringing in one's ears.

h4. See also

* [[traditional youkai]]

They may also be used in lieu of [[toothpick|toothpicks]] for serving hors d'oeuvres and finger foods. They come in a variety of shapes; some resemble tiny [[sword|swords]] while others may be tipped with beads or geometric shapes.

title: rudeus_greyrat
body:
The main protagonist of [[Mushoku Tensei]]. Originally a 34 years old [[NEET]] in his previous life, after he was reincarnated into an another world, he resolves to fulfill a better life in his current world as the son of the Greyrat family.

h4. External links

* "Mushoku Tensei Wiki: Rudeus Greyrat":[https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/Rudeus_Greyrat]

title: pulque
body:
A viscous, milk-colored, alcoholic beverage made from the [i][[agave]] americana[/i] plant.

It became a [[meme]] based on a commercial aired during the broadcast of the final episodes of [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] on April 22, 2011.  The commercial can be seen "here":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QNSesAZuXPE.  The narrator asks "謎の白い液体の正体とは？" (What is the identity of this [[suggestive fluid|mysterious white liquid]]?).  And, of course, only fanartists dare to show us the answer.

h4. See also

* [[Suggestive fluid]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pulque":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pulque

title: miku_miku_ni_shite_ageru_(vocaloid)
body:
みくみくにしてあげる♪ (I'll Make You Miku-Miku-ed ♪)

A song for [[Hatsune Miku]]. By ika aka Kamo Tsuruta (鶴田 加茂).

It is considered of the most iconic Miku songs, often operating as an "anthem" for Miku and [[VOCALOID]]. The lyrics are Miku announcing herself to the world. [b]excerpt from vocaloid wiki[/b].

* "NicoNico Video":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm1097445
* "Youtube Video 3DPV":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UnpSAMnGi78

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid Songs]]
other_names: みくみくにしてあげる♪

title: octoling_player_character
body:
A customizable player character from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series starting from [[Splatoon 2]]. The player can choose an [[Octoling Boy]] or [[Octoling Girl]].

This tag is for the Octoling that serve as the player's character, and for octopus form Octolings. Do not use it for named characters such as [[Marina (splatoon)|]] or [[Shiver_(splatoon)|]].

In [[Splatoon 3]], with the omission of gender-locked hair, the only canonical difference between male and female octolings is their eye masks. Octolings boys do not have an eyelash in the lower outer corners of their eye masks. Please note, however, that this is also subject to artstyle.

See [[Octoling]] (species) Wiki for a list of named Octolings (e.g. the Idols) and a section on how to differentiate between Octoling and [[Inkling]]s.

title: blonney
body:
[b]Blonney[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]

A stereotypical of "extravagant rich girl". She is one of the main character of [b]A Nightmare at Green Lake[/b]. She loves horror movies, and she references a lot of slasher horror movies such as [b]Texas Chainsaw Massacre[/b], [b]Child's Play[/b], and [b]Friday the 13th[/b]. She is also [[Jessica_(reverse:1999)|Jessica]]'s best friend. Her real name is [b]Jennifer Woods[/b]

She was voiced by Addison Holley in English, and [[Saito Shuka]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance
* !post #6815479: Default
* !post #6815483: Insight II: P-P-Pink Lady
* !post #7957298: The Giallo Grind

title: the_night_guest
body:
Ever since the death of her husband, Mrs. Arakawa has run her inn alone. There's never been a guest the seasoned innkeeper couldn't handle... but she's never had to host a hungry oni. It'll take all her wits and wiles to survive the night in his service--or else she may find herself in his mouth.

[i]The Night Guest[/i] is a spin-off from [The Dragon Double Feature 2](https://taylor-titmouse.itch.io/dragondoubled), but takes place before it and can be read as a stand-alone story. This book features an older woman seducing a younger man, size difference, mommy dom, cunnilingus, praise, teaching, cowgirl position, and mating press.

https://taylor-titmouse.itch.io/the-night-guest

She is portrayed as a [[long hair|long]], [[grey hair|grey-haired]] [[fox girl]] with [[blue eyes]]. She wears [[cherry hair ornament|cherry coil ties]] that hold her [[twintails]], which are [[curly hair|curly]] or [[drill hair|drills]], and has a [[halo]] around her [[fox ears|left ear]].

title: elaina_(majo_no_tabitabi)
body:
The main character of [[Majo no Tabitabi]]. A young [[witch]] who enjoys travelling from country to country. Because of her hair color, she is known as [i]The Ashen Witch[/i]. 

She has [[blue eyes]] (sometimes appear [[purple eyes|purple]]), [[small breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] stylized with an [[ahoge]], [[hair between eyes]], and [[sidelocks]]. She usually wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[witch hat|witch's hat]], [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[neck ribbon]], [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[open clothes|open]] [[black robe|black]] [[hooded robe|hooded]] [[robe]]/[[black cloak|black]] [[hooded cloak]], [[black footwear]], and a [[brooch]]. Also [[broom riding|rides a broom]].

Character designed by [[Azuuru]], voiced by [[Hondo Kaede]] in the anime.

title: psychic_miku_(project_voltage)
body:
A character design by [[take_(illustrator)|]] for the [[Pokemon]] and [[Vocaloid]] collaboration [[Project Voltage]] that imagines [[Hatsune Miku]] as a Psychic-type Pokemon trainer. Her Pokemon partner is [[Meloetta (Aria)|Meloetta]].

Psychic Miku has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair]] that [[multicolored hair|switches]] between [[aqua hair|aqua]] and [[green hair|green]]. Her hair is styled as [[twintails]] with some of it [[hair between eyes|reaching between her eyes]]. She wears a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]], a [[white headwear|white]] [[beanie]], [[headphones]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[polo shirt]] with a [[collared shirt|collar]] and [[short sleeves]], a [[single glove|single]] [[white gloves|white glove]] on her right hand, a [[bracelet]] on her left hand, a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[grey skirt]], [[blue socks]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]]. She also carries a [[blue bag|blue]] [[piano print]] [[shoulder bag]] which has a [[bag charm]] as well as various badge pins attached to it.

title: ghost_miku_(project_voltage)
body:
A character design by [[take_(illustrator)|]] for the [[Pokemon]] and [[Vocaloid]] collaboration [[Project Voltage]] that imagines [[Hatsune Miku]] as a Ghost-type Pokemon trainer.

Ghost Miku has [[pale skin]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[very long hair]] that [[gradient hair|goes]] from [[blue hair|blue]] to [[white hair|white]] at the ends. Her hair is styled as [[twintails]] with a couple locks reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]. Parts of her body appear as if they're [[glitch]]ing and her [[detached arm|arms]] and [[detached legs|legs]] seem to be detached from the rest of her body. She wears a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[grey shirt]], a [[white necktie]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[black sleeves]] with a [[print sleeves|print]] that [[sleeves past fingers|extend past her fingers]], a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] [[black skirt]] and [[black thighhighs]].

h4. Official art

title: fairy_miku_(project_voltage)
body:
A character design by [[Mizutani Megumi]] for the [[Pokemon]] and [[Vocaloid]] collaboration [[Project Voltage]] that imagines [[Hatsune Miku]] as a Fairy-type Pokemon trainer.

Fairy Miku has [[colored eyelashes|pink eyelashes]], [[blue eyes|blue]]-[[pink eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[curly hair|curly]] hair with [[sidelocks]] that is a [[two-tone hair|mix]] of [[blue hair|blue]] and [[pink hair|pink]] that she styles in [[twintails]]. Her hair is decorated with [[red flower|red]], [[white flower|white]] and [[yellow flower|yellow]] [[hair flower|flowers]] as well as [[hair ornament|beads]] scattered throughout. She [[nail polish|paints]] her fingernails [[pink nails|pink]] and wears bead [[earrings]], a [[pink choker]] with a [[heart choker|heart in the middle]], a [[pink sweater]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[white collar]] and a [[white neckerchief]], a [[yellow scrunchie]] on her left [[wrist scrunchie|wrist]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[loafers]]. She carries a white [[pillow]] with [[bag charm|charms]] attached to the strap that also appears to function as a [[white bag|bag]].

h4. Official art

* !post #6697959
* !post #6697993

title: utsugi_uyu
body:
A [[Holostars]] [[virtual YouTuber]], part of the group/unit [[Uproar (holostars)|]]. 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[colored inner hair|inner side]] exposed on the forehead and a [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streak]], swept to his right side that [[hair over one eye|covers his right eye]].

His outfit consists of a [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]], a two-tone [[black shirt|black]] and [[white shirt]] with [[ascot]], a white [[belt]], [[black pants]], white [[high heel boots]], and [[black gloves]].

Character design by [[Yonemuro]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #5256302

h4. See also

* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/utsugiuyu]

title: yuzuki_yukari_(a.i._voice_2)
body:
A design for [[Yuzuki Yukari]]'s voicebank on the updated [[A.I. VOICE|A.I.VOICE®2]] engine, illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]].

She has a more casual outfit featuring a white and black theme with green highlights:
* [[short sleeves|Short sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with [[rabbit print]]
* [[black dress|Black]] [[pinafore dress]] with a [[see-through skirt layer]] printed with [[moon phases]]
* White [[asymmetrical legwear]]
* [[Black gloves]] with her signature [[bangle]]
* Purple [[shoulder sash]] and [[belt]]

Kizuna Akari's matching voicebank, [[Kizuna Akari (A.I. Voice 2)]], also has a matching outfit.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6869214

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: yuzuki_yukari_(a.i._voice)
body:
A design for [[Yuzuki Yukari]]'s [[A.I. VOICE]] voicebank, illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]].

She wears a white sleeveless shirt with [[rabbit print]], a [[black jacket]] [[jacket_on_shoulder|over her shoulders]], black [[bike shorts]], [[black thighighs]], and boots. She wears her usual [[bangle]] but has an abbreviated version of her usual [[hair ornament]] that now consists of one circle instead of  two.

Not to be confused with her other A.I. VOICE design, [[Yuzuki Yukari (Shizuku)]], which is a younger version of herself.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4682274

body:

title: yamenaa_(momosuzu_nene)
body:
A mascot/caricature of [[Yukihana Lamy]] drawn by [[Momosuzu Nene]] at the request of [[Omaru Polka]].

A white ball with an [[^o^]] expression, Lamy's signature [[heart ahoge]] and [[bowtie]] and the text "[i]やめなー[/i] "([i]yamenaa[/i], meaning "stop it" or "cut it out"), a catchphrase associated with Lamy and often thrown at Nene's for her rather immature (and quite inappropriate for an idol) sense of humor. It's sometimes drawn with Polka's arms.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #22618357

h4. See also

* [[List of Hololive Mascots]]

h4. External links

* "Reveal tweet":[https://twitter.com/omarupolka/status/1441771620985491461?s=20]

title: emperor_hirohito
body:
[b]Hirohito[/b] (April 29, 1901 – January 7, 1989), also called by his posthumous title [b]Emperor Shōwa/Shouwa[/b], was a Japanese emperor, whose reign (1926–1989) is known as the [[shouwa|Shōwa]] period/era. He was eventually succeeded by son, [[Emperor Akihito|Akihito]], after his death.

He is known for being the Head of State of the [[Japan|Empire of Japan]] during the [[World War II]] era, his interest in marine biology and his signature phrase, "[i]Ah, so[/i]" (あっそう, "I see").

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito]
* [[Tag Group:People]]

title: emperor_antoku
body:
A 12th century emperor of [[Japan]], also known as Imperial Prince Tokihito. As a result of becoming caught up in "the Gempei War":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genpei_War], he died in his eighth year at the battle of Dan-no-ura in 1185. Together with his grandmother, Taira no Tokiko, and the [[Sword of Kusanagi]], one of the [[Japanese Regalia]], he sank to the bottom of sea at the "Kanmon Straits":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanmon_Straits].

[[Shinto]] priests claim that by performing a ritual similar to the rituals used to summon kami spirits into "shintai":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shintai], they are capable of creating sacred replicas of the Regalia, called "katashiro". If one excludes the original Sword of Kusanagi, allegedly enshrined in the "Atsuta Shrine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuta_Shrine], the katashiro of the sword lost at that time is the oldest one.

His death was the source of countless tales and legends. In books such as "Heike Monogatari":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Tale_of_the_Heike and "Gukanshou":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gukansh%C5%8D], this sword was said to have been a treasure of the undersea dragon palace originally, and the [[Yamata no Orochi]] was the Dragon God or a member of its family. In order to retrieve the sword stolen by Susanoo, the Orochi reincarnated as Emperor Antoku.

In Heike Monogatari, there was an account that says when he was born, the traditional rites that are supposed to be performed when a princess is born were performed by mistake. This gave rise to many tales based on the theme that Emperor Antoku was actually female.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Emperor Antoku":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor_Antoku

title: finland
body:
Finland, officially the Republic of Finland, is a sovereign state in Europe. A peninsula with the Gulf of Finland to the south and the Gulf of Bothnia to the west, the country has land borders with Sweden to the northwest, Norway to the north, and Russia to the east. Estonia is south of the country across the Gulf of Finland. Finland is situated in the geographical region of Fennoscandia, which also includes Scandinavia.

title: first_indochina_war
body:
The [b]First Indochina War[/b] was a war between the French Indochinese Independence fighters led by communist [[Vietnam]] and [[France]] who were attempted to regain the control of the colonies, lasted between 1945 and 1954. The war ended with the both sides agreed on a compomised agreement backed by the [[united states|the United States]] to split the country into the communist North and democratic (albeit later dictatorial) South. Tensions between both sides resulted into the [[Vietnam war]] in 1960.

h4. See Also
* [[battle of dien bien phu|the battle of Điện Biên Phủ]]
* [[tag_group:history]]
other_names: 第一次インドシナ戦争

title: battle_of_dien_bien_phu
body: The Battle of Điện Biên Phủ was a climactic confrontation of the First Indochina War that took place between 13 March and 7 May 1954. It was fought between the French Union's colonial Far East Expeditionary Corps and the Viet Minh.

title: geow_(koseki_bijou)
body: [b]Geow[/b] is a pink-and-white rabbit-like creature introduced during [[virtual YouTuber]] [[Koseki Bijou]]'s 3D debut showcase on August 3, 2024. He has a purple gem similar to the gems prominent in Bijou's design on his forehead, and she describes him as her "buddy". Although small, cute, and evidently mute, Geow supposedly possesses terrible destructive powers. "Geow" is an acronym for what Bijou claims is his full name, [b]the Grand Executioner of Worlds[/b].

title: tsurumaru_kuninaga
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character.

A [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]] forged by Gojou Kuninaga. He had gone through several owners (one of them being Oda Nobunaga, so he is often depicted in fanworks alongside other swords owned by him), and was stolen from his owners twice; once from the grave of Sadayasu of the Adachi clan, and also from a shrine by Koudeki of the Honami Clan. He is currently part of the Imperial Collection alongside [[Ichigo Hitofuri]], [[Uguisumaru]] and [[Hirano Toushirou]].

Because of how he tended to be stolen from his resting place, and because of his long life in general, Tsurumaru has a love of surprises and likes to sneak up on people to surprise them. This has naturally earned him a reputation of being a troll in fanworks who plays pranks on the other characters for his own amusement. 

He has [[white hair]] and [[yellow eyes]], and wears [[Japanese clothes]] with a [[hood]] and [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pom pom]]s. He has [[black gloves]] that are [[partially fingerless gloves|partly fingerless]] and [[Japanese armor]] at his waist.

His name is written with the kanji for "[[crane_(animal)|crane]]", and he often references how he resembles one due to his white clothing. Ironically, despite cranes representing longevity and good fortune in Japanese culture, most of his masters did not live long.

h4. See also

* pool #10031 - God Damn It, Tsurumaru!

body:

title: cactus
body: A succulent [[plant]] with a thick, fleshy stem that typically bears spines, lacks leaves, and has brilliantly colored [[flower|flowers]]. Cacti are native to arid regions of the New World and are cultivated elsewhere, especially as houseplants.

title: cucumber
body:
A cylinder-shaped [[fruit]], [i]Cucumis sativus[/i], with a thin green rind and white flesh. It is prepared and eaten as a [[vegetable]], and is a favorite of [[kappa|kappas]]. [[Cat]]s have an [[cats are scared of cucumbers (meme)|instinctual revulsion to the sight of them]]; it is believed they associate their appearance with snakes.

[[Kappamaki]] is a kind of sushi containing cucumber.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: stethoscope
body: The stethoscope is an acoustic medical device for auscultation, or listening to the internal sounds of an animal or human body. It is often used to listen to [[lung]]s and [[heart (organ)|]] sounds. It is also used to listen to the [[stomach]] and [[intestines]] and blood flow in [[arteries]] and [[veins]]. In combination with a [[blood pressure monitor]], it is commonly used for measurements of blood pressure.

Use this tag if an image contains either an exterior view of a hotel with a suggestive name on a sign (like [i]休憩 ¥XXXX[/i]), or if characters in the image imply or mention that they're going to a love hotel with the building visible in the image. 

Combine with [[hotel room]] if the image shows a hotel room but with elements such as a suggestively-themed bed, or sex toys on the night stand, or hotel-issued condoms in a small container near the bed, etc.

title: camel
body: An even-hoofed animal of the genus Camelus with distinctive fat deposits on its back called humps. The two species of camels are the [[dromedary camel]], native to the Middle East and the Horn of Africa, and the [[bactrian camel]], which inhabits Central Asia. Both camels have been domesticated and are working animals that provide milk, meat, and hair for commodities such as textiles or felted bags.

title: barber_pole
body: A sign used to indicate the location of a barber's shop. They typically consist of a helix of white, red, and blue stripes, sometimes powered by an electric motor to rotate.

title: mount_fuji
body:
富士山 (ふじさん)

Highest [[mountain]] in [[Japan]] at 3,776 m (12,388 ft), and one of the iconic images of the nation. Although it has not erupted in over 300 years, it is still an active [[volcano]].

h4. See Also

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_Fuji

title: tokyo_tower
body:
A steel lattice communications and observation tower in [[Tokyo (city)|Tokyo]]. Opened in 1958, it is painted white and international orange to comply with air safety regulations and has two circular observation decks, features which help distinguish it from its inspiration, the [[Eiffel Tower]]. It is also surrounded by high rise buildings, the presence of which hampered plans to use the Tower for digital broadcasting in the region, and resulted in the building of the taller [[Tokyo Skytree]].

It is the setting of the tokusatsu series [[Kamen Rider Kabuto (series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]], as well as being an important location in [[Ghostwire: Tokyo]].

* !asset #22533589: "View of the tower":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Tower#/media/File:Tokyo_Tower_during_daytime.jpg

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

h4. External links

* "Official English website":https://www.tokyotower.co.jp/en/
* "Wikipedia: Tokyo Tower":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Tower

title: statue_of_liberty
body:
The [b]Statue of Liberty[/b] ([i]Liberty Enlightening the World[/i], French: [i]La Liberté éclairant le monde[/i]) is a colossal neoclassical [[statue]] on Liberty Island in [[New York City]] Harbor.

The statue, a gift to the [[United states|United States]] from the people of [[France]], is of a robed female figure representing Libertas, the Roman goddess of freedom, who bears a torch and a tabula ansata (a tablet evoking the law) upon which is inscribed the date of the American Declaration of Independence. A broken chain lies at her feet. The statue has become an iconic symbol of freedom and of the United States.

The statue was designed by Frédéric Bartholdi and dedicated on October 28, 1886. It stands 93 meters high and weighs 204 metric tonnes. Inside the statue is a staircase that allows visitors to climb from the pedestal all the way up to the crown above her head.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Statue of Liberty":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Statue_of_Liberty
